Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: InternationalGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt to attend a special event at the hotel. We were upgraded to one of the nicer suites with views of Coit Tower. The room was amazing with living room, big screen tv - perfect for entertaining and bedroom with lots of windows and spa like bathroom. Beds are comfortable, great bedding and linens for a wonderful night's sleep.The hotel has gone through a renovation that makes the hotel modern yet comfortable. The on premise bar and restaurant made it easy for meals, snacks and drinks. The location in the heart of the waterfront and Fisherman's Wharf make this an excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBoomermom
Reviews.Content: We had 2 adjoining rooms for our party of 5. The king room was exceptionally spacious and the double just fine although the walls were a bit thin and we could hear our night owl neighbors' chatter. We had a glimpse of a bay view and choose not use the outdoor pool as it was on the cool side and closed early. Very convenient to the cable car and Fisherman's Wharf. The Hollywood Cafe across the street was excellent for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a conference!”
Reviews.Author: Matsibi
Reviews.Content: I expected a bit more upscale than what I found but all the accomodations were nice. Staff was very friendly. Rooms were decorated with retro style. Cool for an older hotel. It made sense. Food was excellent in all venues, the conference center, Knucles and room service.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for tourists but not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hahee
Reviews.Content: Ok, for tourists this hotel may be ok. As a business hotel it is not what you're looking for. The rooms are clean but small and missing stuff you may need. As e example, there is no shower gel (just cheap soap), no mini bar, no inside pool and a real lobby ( where you can read some paper or waiting for people) . This is not what I expect from a Hyatt. The location is not that great,to far away from the center. Overall a mass tourist hotel with friendly employees but not a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Predictable In A Very Positive Way”
Reviews.Author: Forestvillian
Reviews.Content: Due to their impersonal, clonish nature Iâ€™ve never been a fan of big name hotel chains, but Iâ€™ve always had good experiences at the Hyatts Iâ€™ve stayed at. The Hyatt at Fishermanâ€™s Wharf proved to be no exception during our recent overnight stay. The lobby was surprisingly small and seemed to be focused on being entirely functional. The decor was commercially bland and I have no recollection of any details that usually define hotel lobbies. Check-in was a breeze and the front desk personnel (as well as the valet we turned our vehicle over to) were friendly and efficient. My request for a check-out time that was 90 minutes later than standard was cheerfully granted. I had also requested a room in a quiet area of the hotel, and we were given one on the top (5th) floor in an area far from the elevators--which was fine, as the location was much quieter and we got a little exercise too! Our room #587 wasnâ€™t overly large, but it did feel spacious and bright with a bank of windows across the far wall. No attractive views as the room overlooked North Point and the large Holiday Inn Express building across the street. Decor was contemporary with interesting, large format graphic art on the walls. Colors were blue-greys and chocolate. The room was clean and fresh looking for the most part, althoâ€™ there was some worn paint on the deskâ€™s edges and on the doors. The connecting door between our room and the next did allow conversations and TV in the neighboring room to be heard, but at night our room was pleasantly quiet and restful. No traffic sounds were evident. The King bed was quite comfortable. Our room also had a small L-shaped chaise/sofa, small coffee table, a long desk with a nice amount of workspace and multiple power outlets conveniently located above the desk top. (Iâ€™m always surprised and annoyed that many hotel rooms require you to crawl around searching under furniture and drapes in order to access outlets). We had a 32â€� flat panel Samsung TV, clock radio/mp3/iPod player, and 2-line phone in our room. It was nice to have a larger-than-countersize freestanding refrigerator and a single-cup coffee maker--or any coffee maker for that matter, as so many hotels donâ€™t include them in their rooms. There were 3 table lamps plus a floor lamp, and the lamps on the bedstands provided adequate light to read by (which isnâ€™t the case in many hotels and inns). The thermostat-controlled heating, a/c system kept our room comfortable and we were able to just turn it off at night. Clothes hanging space was surprisingly minimal, with a very narrow area to accommodate longer garments and 2 deep drawers in place of a separate dresser or chest. There was an in-room safe, iron and full-size ironing board. The bathroom had marble flooring, counters and shower surround. There was an oversized, walk-in shower (no tub) which didnâ€™t have an adjustable showerhead; the water sprayed down thru a grate from ceiling level. There was a fixed glass partition that extended about 60% across the shower area with the remaining area open--and that allowed water from the shower to seep out onto the floor. It was a very odd arrangement. Looked good, but wasnâ€™t functional! Water pressure in the shower was fine, but in order to achieve a comfortable temperature I needed to turn the lever all the way to the hot side. The toilet worked efficiently. Bathroom counterspace was spacious. The single basin was very shallow but somehow didnâ€™t allow water to splash out--a nice design! There was a full-length mirror and a makeup mirror in addition to the mirrored wall above the counter. Lighting and ventilation were both good. A hairdryer was provided. We took a look at the outdoor pool (lap-type) and whirlpool which are located in a sheltered, somewhat austere courtyard area; checked the water temperature (nice), but didnâ€™t have an opportunity to try them. The Hyatt has a wine bar and lounge on premises and a casual restaurant/sports bar (Knuckles). Resembling a chain coffee shopâ€™s interior, the restaurant just didnâ€™t look inviting enough to have breakfast at the next morning, so we instead walked a few blocks to the Blue Mermaid which is adjacent to the Argonaut Hotel. The Hyattâ€™s location was perfect for us as we planned to walk to Gary Danko for dinner and also walk to the Hyde Street Pier/Maritime Museum and Fort Mason the next morning. It was great to give up our car for the duration of our stay and the valet parking fee of $51 (inc. tax) was reasonable enough for being in San Francisco. All in all it was a great stay at a comfortably reliable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Bertram W
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Hyatt F-Wharf and the service from the staff was superior-in comparision to some of the top hotels in San Francisco. The breakfast at Knuckles was excellent and the staff was very attentive. If you stay at this hotel, try getting a room on the fourth floor close to the fitness center if you are a work-out junkie-great equipments. If you need to get downtown SFO quickly for a business meeting, dinner or some shopping, you can reserved a towncar at the front desk. Great location to all the activities/restaurants on Fisherman's Wharf... Kudos to Dania and Elizabeth for the great service!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: jac4444
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with the kids for a few nights to do Alcatraz and other Fisherman's Wharf attractions, even though we only live an hour away. I was surprised at how quiet our room was. It may have been because it was low-occupancy during mid-week in the middle of winter. But it was awesomely quiet. It was walking distance to lots of fun stuff to see and do and good restaurants. The staff was nice and the rooms were nice and decent sized. Parking was ridiculously expensive. We parked at a nearby lot for half the price the hotel wanted to charge. I hope I get the chance to stay here again. Oh, also the breakfast buffet was delicious, though would have been nice if they'd had a kids price since they only eat a few bites of eggs and a muffin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: chshenrique
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel in FishermanÂ´s Wharf. With a confotables rooms and excellent staff attention. The breakfest is delicious. With location near Pier 39, Walgreens, parkings (if you rent a car). I recommed this hotel in SFO

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt at Fisherman's wharf.”
Reviews.Author: Alex K
Reviews.Content: We drove up from LA via Monterey as part of our coastal sightseeing tour. We booked this hotel prior to arrival. When we checked in, the staff said that the room we book (2 doubles or similar) was not available. Instead, they booked us a 2 room (two bedrooms, a kitchenette, couch, sinks, two bathroom and big table) suite up on the 8th floor. We were very pleased and inpressed especially because we didn't pay anything extra. Our stay was very comfortable and enjoyable. The pool was on the 3rd floor but was outside (with San Fran weather, was not good) and very large. The problem I had with this hotel was that on our 3rd night, there was a large wedding being held in the banquet and the guest were very noisy and did illegal things. The cops came and arrested a few and the weddign party had to be asked to leave. The other minor problem I had with this hotel was that our 2nd T.V. kept on braking down and we had to get a mechanic up to fix it almost every day. The good thing was that he gave us free Wi-Fi because we complained instead of paying $10 a day. I would recommend this hotel to buisness travellers and to families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: anijean
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times because during the summer of '11 my boyfriend was captained a cruise ship that docked in San Francisco every ten days. It's a beautiful facility and is a great location to see both touristy stuff and downtown San Fran stuff from. I enjoyed the late check out offers each time and the good room service. The front desk was always helpful and incredibly accommodating even more than I expected them to be. I've heard people complain about the price but for the location and facility it's a great deal to me. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Girls Trip to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: GeminiBlue52
Reviews.Content: We had the best time in San Francisco and our stay at the Hyatt. The concierge worked with us to pick out the best tours and offered us suggestions on where to eat. All of his suggestions were good and were appreciated. Our breakfast buffett was included in our stay and I can't say enough good things about it. The food was always good with lots of variety. The omlettes were excellent as well. The wait staff were wonderful, even went so far as to give us take out boxes so we could take a muffin, fruit and some nuts with us on our tours - even gave us bottled water to take one day. They gave us adjoining rooms which we found to be perfect for us. Our accomodations were excellent - very upscale and modern. Big flat screen tv with very comfortable beds. We were close to everything - even the trolly and walked a lot. Our tours picked us up at the hotel too. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: rsoxman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco for 6 days. The staff was really attentive and helpful. We loved this location because it was one block to the wharf but far enough away that it was very quiet. I would recommend this hotel without reservation. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, some updating in room would help”
Reviews.Author: jakeiszues
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. This is a nice property with a great location for families. Staff is great. Nice room but some things need better upkeep such as scratched up desk and window shades. Pool is nice. Parking is expensive, but on par for San Francisco. Restaurant is nice and good for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not exceptional but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: BluDragonFlyer
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in courtyard-facing room with double beds. The rooms are for the most part updated with a contemporary vib, except the bathroom shower which was dated and had some mold around the caulking. I have stayed at several other hotels in this area over the past several years and this is one of the better options. The room was quiet (I could not hear other guests & the doors close quietly). The flat-screen TV, the white comforter duvette, abundant counter space in the bathroom, and make-up mirror are all bonuses. There are no luggage racks in the room--there is a built-in area you are supposed to use (I guess?). Check-in was easy and fast, staff were friendly. I led a two-day conference at the hotel and the banquet staff were excellent--and the food was very good. My only complaint was that our meeting hall was pretty cramped--but it was quiet. The elevators either stop at the conference level or the hotel lobby level--1/2 floor difference. So you have to pay attendtion to the button you push. The hotel is about three blocks from a Trader Joe's, four blocks from the curvey Lombard St, and in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf and cable car rides. So great location for walking around after your meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great price”
Reviews.Author: NicoleR1221
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed here for six nights. We were very pleased with the hotel and the location. The concierge got us a restaurant reservation at a nice restaurant on very short notice on Valentine's Day. They helped us navigate around the city, and were very congenial. It was quiet in the hallways despite being a full house. Didn't eat in the restaurant next door until the last night and then were dissappointed that we didn't take advantage of the $5 happy hour specials. Loved staying in the wharf as it is close to all kinds of transport . . . having traveled all over the city during this trip, I would not stay in any other section but the wharf. Wonderful trip and easy to get around. Hyatt was great. Oh, and nice products in the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist A Go Go”
Reviews.Author: SoCALcanuck
Reviews.Content: Although I was in town for business and needed to stay in the F Wharf area, I can see this Hyatt being a great hotel for tourist types (near F Wharf, Pier 39, etc.). Rooms were up to date, beds and pillows solid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Cpalyo
Reviews.Content: Great location near Pier 39 and Fisherman's Warf. Walking distance to Safeway and numerous restaurants. Valet parking a little tight when multiple cars arrive at the same time. Very nice hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “This a rate on the hotel, but overall just don't stay in the wharf”
Reviews.Author: Mikebrez
Reviews.Content: Let me run this down real quick without making this into a review about staying in fisherman's wharf instead the hyatt. All the really nice hotels are not in the wharf even brands like the top chains their locations down here are lacking, not special, old, dirty etc.. The wharf is not lets spend everyday for a week there place anyway... theres a day or day and half of stuff to do and see there and thats it. then you will driving, cabbing or trolleying around the different areas of the city that are actually more appealing. Taking a bus tour is a good way to get a grasp of where you want to spend time. ok... sorry. To the Hyatt... When i'm traveling and staying at what i think will be a nice hotel i want to have the "this is nice" feeling when i walk in the lobby and the room. Anything can happen from there based on luck really. But, if you don't start with that you're in trouble. Pulling up to a small hard to locate, small cove of a drive entry there was no valet in sight. ok.. maybe getting a car, but you should have more than one just because of that. after getting out my own bags, then standing there for about 5 minutes here he comes and looks at me like i am going to go park it myself. So i "talk him into valeting the car" then i wrestle my bags(heavy) into the very small lobby(i thought it was the concierge desk). i booked a king standard room, i have someone that would prefer to sleep in the bed with me like normal. Well that was to much to ask and they could only put me in a two bed room(not queens) i'm talking small beds. keep in mind i booked a king. its beautiful view of the brick wall was amazing... the beds were decent to sleep in, by decent i don't mean great. I hindsight its amazing what kind of night sleep you can get in your own bed at night. lol. In the morning i went and looked at the breakfast, knowing how service is so far and decided to skip a 50 dollar breakfast and go get food in the wharf. smart choice plenty to pick from whenever. checking out i was going to stop and complain but said why bother.. so getting off the elevator to get into the lobby and i have two 60 lbs bags, then there is these three steep stairs to actually get on to the lobby floor out right out of the elevator, no ramp.. so i a wrestle the bags up the stairs(ok not ny first time), but the point there are bell hops watching me do it. didn't move a muscle, then when i got to them " is there anything i can help you with"? (yes please get fired, is what i thought). then back out to the valet where asking for your car is like asking for then to help you move two states away. same attitude as when i got there. I am always an over tipper even when my better half says to give them a bad tip. I don't believe in no tip, so i gave him 50 cents. I hoped it woke him up a bit, to see is worth. Stay downtown... trolley to the sites and the wharf. A mistake is to think staying there is in the heart of the action or sites its not just one. If you really want to stay down there save the money and go for a hampton/fairfield level hotel free breakfast at those places and will be just as nice as their parent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel at fisherman's warf”
Reviews.Author: HatOrth
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms. Free internet with gold membership. Got it spontaneously. Modern hotel. Location for the warf very nice but 20 m from the convention center. Got great deal through Expedia . Next to cable car and F train station 1 m walk.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice if staying at Fisherman's wharf..”
Reviews.Author: MrWiz1
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at this hotel after trying other brands in the area. This is a good choice nr the wharf, nice bar/restaurant(called Knuckles) on site, a couple of minutes from the main wharf and pier 39 for the Alcatraz trip. Gym was small, pool was closed initially, now open again with the outdoor jacuzzi..

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: Hotel is maybe a bit business like, but that can be the only compliant. Otherwise it is in an excellent location, within walking distance of Fisherman's wharf. It is also possible to walk from Union Square back if you wish to enjoy the sights of the city and cope with the hilly terrain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mockx3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at The Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf (1/26/12-1/29/12). It was a wonderful experience. I have never met more friendly staff. Our rooms were large, clean, and very bright. The bed was amazingly comfortable. One of our rooms had a regular tub, while the other was a more modern shower (from the ceiling), so if you have a preference be sure to ask. The hotel is only two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, right around the corner from a cable car stop (we rode all the way to Union Square), and there are always cabs out front (which we used to go to Golden Gate Bridge, and back to the airport). We booked a tour through the hotel without a hitch. The staff even remembered the next day and asked how the tour went! Great buffet breakfast in the hotel restaurant (Knuckles). Cannot say enough good things about this terrific hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Avereage hotel in a "tourist trap" area”
Reviews.Author: K_K_travellers
Reviews.Content: The Fishermanâ€™s Wharf area disappointed us as it felt like staying in an English holiday resort from the 1970â€™s. The hotel is average. The room was ok and quiet, despite facing a busy street. The lobby a bit cramped, especially annoying with lifts at different levels in the lobby. Short distance to the cable car. We will not stay here again, mainly because of the area.

Reviews.Title: “HYATT FISHERMANS WHARF”
Reviews.Author: Tharesh
Reviews.Content: My stay was disappointing. Bed sheets were torn. The bed was out of shape and uncomfortable. Breakfast was overpriced. Across the road we found a little coffee shop where we had a filling tasty breakfast for $10

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hyatt Property”
Reviews.Author: sharksfansd
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel at last minute and no regrets doing so. The front desk was fantastic and the room was cozy. The location worked out perfect too. A couple of small issues (which by no means would prevent me from staying again), the elevator was a tad slow and the TV reception was not all that hot on some channels.

Reviews.Title: “bad start and good ending”
Reviews.Author: carey44
Reviews.Content: I had booked 2 rooms thru Hotwire for a two night stay from Jan, 11t to the 13th. We arrived at 11:30pm at night tired after a long day. The valet greeted us and parked our car right away. We went in to check-in and gave the gentleman at the front desk our name. He pulled up our reservation and told me there was only 1 room booked for our party of 6 people. I showed him the reciept for the 2 rooms I booked and pre-paid for allready. After about 30 minutes of arguing with the front desk of who screwed up them or Hotwire he finally gave us the 2 rooms i booked. I forgot to get the gentlemans name at the front desk who helped us but he did make up for the inconvenience of making us wait for 30 minutes while they figured out the rooms. He comped us the fee for parking for 2 nights $90.00 ( yes parking is $45 per night) and gave us free internet service, another $10 per night. So a big thank you to the front desk for making things right. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. The room had a fridge, 2 beds, flat screen tv, shower and tub combo, and a ipod clock radio and a safe in the room. The hotel is in a great location and close to many popular things to do in San Fran. i would stay at this hotel again for the right price. The hotel is what you would expect from a Hyatt property.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: DCTerry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a good stay at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf. The late night front desk guy, William, was beyond earger to help and super friendly. For our departure, he booked a town car to take us to the airport which was $5 less than what a cab would have been-- and much classier. The room was very clean and comfortable. There was a fridge in the room for your use. No minibar. My only complaint is that the room was very dark. Even with all of the lights on, it still felt like the room was dark. I find this to be common in hotels these days, but this seemed to be darker than normal. Otherwise, the room was great and well situated for a touristy weekend in San Fran. I would definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt fishermans wharf”
Reviews.Author: jimmymac131
Reviews.Content: Good hotel , room was clean staff was friendly . The only problems we had was no small store to get simple things being from the east coast and up at 430 am nothing was open and was starving. Also they took the morning coffee away to quick in the lobby .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, standard Hyatt accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Katong
Reviews.Content: Good Location. Behind it is the cable car line. Bought a 3 day pass for $21 and took cable cars every day. Well worth it as each ride would have cost $6. The kids enjoy the scenic ride. Hotel near to wharf attractions and restaurants. But rather quiet at night. Should have stayed near Union Square where it is more lively especially at Christmas time. Hotel itself is rather standard. Wifi and car park charges were too high. Should ask for room near lift or else have to walk far to the room.

Reviews.Title: “THE HYATT AT FISHERMAN'S WHARF”
Reviews.Author: SGRIERSON
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights over Christmas. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. They gave us a room with a nice city view. The room was quiet. The room decor was modern and very clean. Nice towels and bathroom amenities also. We also got a very reasonable rate through our AARP membership. They also have a house car to take you to the airport or around town. I would be glad to recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy! Will stay here next time we are in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Mycutekitties
Reviews.Content: Walking into the hotel we were greeted with warm friendly smiles. The lady at the front desk was very helpful and let us check into our room early. Our room was very clean and updated. This hotel is right around the corner from Fisherman's wharf. Easy 5 min walk with our 5 & 7 year olds. We will stay at this hotel next time! Everything is perfect and we felt like true "guests". The employees all look happy so the management must be doing a great job! Thanks again! The Cromwell's in Modesto

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfy Beds, Updated, Great Restaurant on premises”
Reviews.Author: Wtravel66
Reviews.Content: 2 things I dd not like about this property - First: no parking - valet parking $45! a night AND it is full most of the time, so you have to park in a Parking garage 4 blocks away. Second: pool was closed for renovations, no prior warning, no price adjustment for that, instead we were offered to go 5 blocks away and swim at Radisson for free - inconvenient. If I wanted a hotel without a pool - I could've went to many of the other ones right there on Fisherman's warf for at least $50 less per night. Otherwise good beds, clean, updated, restaurant on property is really good. Suprisingly quet also, easy to sleep. Close to warf, cable car stop, sightseeing tours, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Oddest Shower Design Ever”
Reviews.Author: kappgurl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are a decent size. The rooms either have been or are in the process of being remodeled; including the bathroom which had the oddest shower I have ever been in. There is NO door. There is a stationary glass wall separating the kamode from the shower but there is no door or curtain to open/close. The shower "head" is in the ceiling and you have to step into the shower in order to turn the water on. Unless you have long arms, you end up getting doused in cold water just to turn on the shower. Other than that, the hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Captain38
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a business conference in Vegas and came to San Francisco for a long weekend afterwards. We like being in the Fisherman's Wharf area and chose the Hyatt as the nicest hotel in the area. I can't say enough about how helpful and accomodating the entire front Lobby staff was. Everyone went out of their way to make sure the room had all the amenities that we needed. The hotel itself was clean, recently updated and in a perfect location. Short walking distance to many major attractions in additon to a Safeway, Trader Joes and numerous family type restaurants. A great stay in a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Vacationtime79
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco in December. The best part of the hotel is its location. Other than that it was a very standard hotel with almost no personal touch. The room looked small and kind of dark. There is valet parking for about USD 44 plus tax. This is way too expensive so we parked on the street overnight for free right outside the hotel. Just remember that you need to feed the meter at 7am. For us this was not a problem as we were jet-lagged and would wake up early anyway. What I really did not like was that I made 2 phone calls to San Jose from the hotel phone. The first one lasted one minute and cost 8 dollars. The second call lasted 2 minutes and was 9 dollars. When we were checking out I saw the calls on the bill and could not believe my eyes. I still find it totally rediculous to be charged 8 dollars for a call of under 1 minute from San Francisco to San Jose. The receptionist told me my calls were "long distance" and that she never uses the phone at hotels where she stays. Really?! I couldn't believe the explanation. After I asked who I should speak to, she waived the charges for one of the phones and blamed AT&T for setting high prices. Overall, I would most likely not return to this hotel and I am starting to question whether I would like to stay at another Hyatt again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ccmcbs
Reviews.Content: Don't expect the upscale highrise Hyatt. This is a Hyatt upgrade of an preexisting building. All of the buildings in the wharf area are the same height, so don't bother requesting a room with a view. This is about a location convenient to the wharf/touristy area of the city. Our room was very nice and comfortable (flatscreen t.v., upgraded bed linens, nice bed, travertine bathroom tile and vessel sink) and we were able to check in at 10:00 a.m. Staff are super friendly and helpful. The lobby is small, as is the parking area for check in. There is a nice but pricey restaurant and bar. Coin operated washers and dryers are conveniently located on each floor. Bus stops are nearby as is a cable car ride up to the Coit Tower area. Nearby are restaurants like Denny's and Ihop, McDonald's, In and Out Burger, and then nicer spots west of Fisherman's Wharf and near the Alcatraz pier. Car rental agencies are a block over in case you want to rent a car for the day to go to Monterrey, Saulsalito, etc. The BART stop and Alcatraz pier are a 10" brisk walk away, and there are no hills, so plan the extra walk time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Fishermans wharf”
Reviews.Author: onlyslightlyLost
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at The Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf for 2 days. First, I would suggest that you look for any special deal that includes parking. Parking in the Fisherman's Wharf area, and downtown SF for that matter, is very expensive. A taxi ride from the airport, SFO, will set you back about $60.00. On occasion, the Hyatt has a Town Car that will take you back to the airport for $65.00, plus tip. The good thing about that is that you can add it as a room charge. If you are only staying one or two days, a car rental may, in fact, be cheaper and give you more flexibility. If you can find a deal with parking, then the rental is the way to go. The Hotel is ideally situated for hanging out at the Wharf. It is not actually on Fisherman's wharf / Jefferson Street, which is, In my opinion, a good thing. It is only 2 blocks off the wharf area, which makes the area less noisy and crowded. Additionally, right behind the hotel is the starting station for the Powell & Mason cable car line, which will take you to Union Square and Market Street, and all the upscale shopping. Coming back from Union square you can take the Powell & Hyde cable car line which will take you, and ends at, the Ghiradelli Square/ Victorian Park area. This is also the west end of the Fisherman's wharf area, so you can walk down Fisherman's wharf and then back to the hotel with ease. An additional note about the cable cars: a single trip costs $6.00, but a day pass costs $14.00. So if you are going to try to take more than just one round trip, or get off and on - like stopping in China town on the way to Union Square, then the day pass is the way to go. When trying to get back from Union Square, I suggest that you go the the starting point of the cable car line at Powell and Market Street. The cable cars tend to be full by the time they get to Union Square and if you are lucky enough to get on one, it will probably be standing on the outside and hanging on. That is a true San Francisco experience and fine for 20 somethings, but not so much fun for seniors or people with shopping bags. The hotel itself is a typical Hyatt. The staff are friendly and efficient. The room are clean and well appointed. The King room we stayed in was roomy and had a desk with plenty of plugs for the computer and charging phones, etc. Note that there is a $9.95 per day WiFi charge. The hotel has a restaurant / sports bar. The food is fine but, as with any hotel, a little pricey. All in all, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMac10_10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for its proximity to the water and the Golden Gate Bridge. It's also within walking distance to Ghiradelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf. The cable car station is close too which can take you to lots of other places in the city. The hotel was up-to-date and had very comfortable beds. We loved having Knuckles, the sports bar next door. We booked the free parking special which also came with a breakfast buffet at Knuckles. The buffet had hot & cold options and was a nice spread, more choices than most. There were also made-to-order omelets available. We also enjoyed Knuckles at the end of the day for a drink and some football. The concierge at the hotel was helpful & had lots of recommendations for things to do. We'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Richard T
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for its location - in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf and a very short walk to Pier 39. That turned out to be spot on, but the hotel was really good in many ways. Check in and out were quick, efficient and friendly. On checking out, they tried to charge a higher rate than that agreed during check-in but that was quickly corrected. Breakfast was included in our room rate and it was a delicious range of hot and cold buffet items, with attentive waitresses and friendly chefs. The management told us that consruction work was going on but we were never aware of any disruption. In fact the hotel was really quiet and peaceful. We had large, comfortable, clean rooms. One very minor complaint from the females in our party was that the ambient temperature in some public areas was 2-3 degrees C cooler than they'd prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: SummerGirl55_9
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hyatt Hotel on November 6th and was extremely tired after an 11hr flight, upon arrival we had a quick and easy check in by accomodating and helpful staff. Our room had a beautiful view of San Fransisco and was very very spacious, the bed was huge and very comfortable, the bathroom had everything you needed but no bath however it was fine - just after a long day of walking i wanted a nice soak! Location wise it's great - you can easily grab a tram or bus up to Union Square (if you do go to Union Square you must eat at the Daily Grill - best steak ever!) and a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf - Perfect! I never had a chance to eat at the restaurant but did order room service one night which was good - BBQ chicken and a steak and also reasonably priced. We had a great server - i am not sure what her name was but she was fantastic and even gave us a bottle of complimentary water ($5 if you buy yourself). On our last day check out was easy and smooth and the bell boy outside (sorry didn't get him name either) was absolutley fantastic and couldn't of helped us anymore! I would love to stay here again and would like to thanks SF Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wallygator53
Reviews.Content: Steps from Fisherman's Wharf and attractions. Room was nice and clean, staff was friendly. Good value, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RachelKillen
Reviews.Content: We changed our hotel at the last minute after reading dreadful reviews for one in downtown. The Hyatt was excellent, the staff were friendly and helpful and the room was excellent and it was only $10 more than the downtown one! The barman was great, super friendly and very organised. This hotel is a 2 minute walk to the wharf where there is heaps to see and do. My only gripe was that there was no mini bar, but on second thoughts that was probably a good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: DutchieGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 2 blocks walk from Fisherman's Wharf. It's in a very convenient location for restaurants and also for public transport and tours as most tours start in Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel itself has a restaurant. I ate lunch there and it was great food. price wise it's not too bad. A little on the expensive side for what the food is, but it's in the touristy area, so that's to be expected. The hotel itself was clean and seemed to be well looked after and the concierge was very helpful. I had asked for a quiet, non-smoking room, which is what I received. However my room was on the same level as the pool, and I think if it had been summer, my room would not have been so quiet. The room was clean and I saw no signs of damage. The bed was comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. The aircon/heating could be heard, but for me it was not a problem as I am used to "white noise" while sleeping. I had only a couple of "gripes". Firstly, I put the "privacy" tag on the door after my first night as I did not need new towels or anything done in the room, however when I got back from the tour I was doing, housekeeping had been in, removed all the towels, moved a lot of my stuff, left the curtains open (which I actually did not realise at first when I walked in the room and I had started to get changed when I realised - luckily no one was in the pool!) and this made me feel very uneasy. I did speak to reception about it, and it was fixed for the next day. Also, I paid cash when I checked in and also paid the $13 a day for internet, but when i tried to use the internet it wouldn;t work. I called reception and the man at reception was telling me I had not left a deposit. I had to explain three times that I had paid cash when I checked in because he kept saying I had to use my credit card. After telling him the third time, he put me on hold and checked it out. He then apologized and said he could see I had paid already and he patched me through to internet support to get me set up. I just don;t know why I had to explain 3 times that I had already paid before he went to check it out instead of him just saying they needed my credit card and that I had not paid. Otherwise, I did like the hotel. It was convenient and clean and that is what I want in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt @ Fisherman's Wharf - will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: acw3111
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, well appointed room., centrally located if you want to walk around Fisherman's Wharf. Like all Hyatt's Starbuck's coffee in room, extra bathroom amenities. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Get Any Closer to the Best of the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Asiaexpat81
Reviews.Content: I usually opt for tiny boutique hotels, but this time I wanted to be in the "thick" of the wharf and always try to stay at Hyatts when possible (Gold Passport member), so this was a perfect choice. The rooms were spacious and airy. The hotel staff were fabulous (I actually wrote an email to the GM afterwards to say that the room cleaning and maintenance staff were just about the cheeriest hotel staff I've ever met worldwide....always a smile, always kind, always attentive and wanting to know what else they could do right at that moment, even if just passing them in the hallway). The internet was fast and the concierge extremely helpful, as was the reception staff. Location just fantastic as so accessible to everything the Wharf has to offer. One night I needed to work in my room (and didn't want room service) so I quickly walked the two blocks to the take-away seafood stalls and was able to bring back steaming hot seafood to my room. Gym was great but SF weather did not obey and even the heated pool could not tempt me...alas. A fine stay though and would readily stay at this specific Hyatt once again.

Reviews.Title: “Convent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Eaglebeak1
Reviews.Content: Great location near good restaurants. Very accessible to Muni transportation. Has heated pool, hot tub and workout room. Staff is very helpful. Go to concierge for help about local attractions and restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: gandalfNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week and couldn't be more pleased with the staff (extremely helpful, friendly and professional), location, amenities and overall value of this hotel. Had an oversized room on the 5th floor and was very pleased. The location is a great jumping off point to all areas of SF by cable car (Mason-Hyde stop directly behind hotel), trolley, bus, walking, etc. Highly recommend not renting a car and getting a MUNI pass for your length of stay. This covers all public transportation except BART. The guys who run the cable cars are a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for a hotel at Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: lisa D
Reviews.Content: Great Location.You can walk around Pier 39. Lots of restaurants close by. Service was good. Room was clean. Gym and pool were nice. Great deal with Travel zoo coupon. Free breakfast and Wi-fi. Parking was 50% off.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities without the attitude”
Reviews.Author: nyc_city_slicker
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of the Hyatt Chain. When my cab pulled up I assumed my company was seriously tightening the purse strings. The lobby is *very* basic, but don't judge a book by it's cover. * Rooms: modern, neat and spacious. * Gym: top quality, especially for a hotel * Pool: I didn't even know there was a pool until I stumbled upon it. It was cute and serviceable, I wish I had known! * Location: very walkable to lots of great amenities Great amenities without the attitude; I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but basic rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Linux24
Reviews.Content: Having been to the Hyatt in Australia I had high expectations coming to this one, unfortunately the level of quality and features was very disappointing . The room lacked the following : 1- no mini bar fridge ( useful when you want to store your own drinks and food ) 2- no iron included 3- tv reception on many channels was bad 4- no bath, just shower Final verdict, I would have chosen holiday inn express opposite it for half the price as I stayed in there last year so could compare the 2

Reviews.Title: “just what you expect from Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: andcil_11
Reviews.Content: Nice accommodation in a beautiful part of San Francisco. the rooms are pretty much up to date and in very good condition. my only complaints are the lack of bar fridge in the room and the sliding door into the bathroom wasn't very private.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel by the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn822
Reviews.Content: The service by the hotel staff was wonderful. Our flight arrived early, and they allowed us early check-in. The rooms were very nicely appointed, and extremely clean. Relaxing view and bed during our four day vacation!

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: lancenbecky
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to the wharf and the cable car stop is 1 block from the hotel. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. Service and the staff were great as well. Knuckles the hotel Bar and Grill was fun and lively.

Reviews.Title: “More than Comfortable in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NaugJoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night in CA before heading north to wine country. The rooms were very clean, staff was friendly and helpful, and the bed was just what we needed to rest up before our vacation. It was a bit pricy, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: tabgirl4
Reviews.Content: Great location. We had a basic room. We didn't have a view, but we were hardly ever in the room. The room was clean, the bathroom was a great size with a great shower. The bed was so comfortable. the service was great and friendly. Knuckles, the hotel bar was great and lively. Would definitely stay here again. The only downside is that there wasn't a breakfast included in the price, and Parking at $45 a day was a bit steep (apparently average for San Francisco), but we got a great price on the room and overall we were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and base for seeing San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SteveW13
Reviews.Content: We would recommend the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf for first timers to San Francisco like ourselves. We couldn't have asked for a better location, it was within easy walking distance to the shops and restaurants on Pier 39, the ferry terminal for Alcatraz and the cable car turnaround for Chinatown and Market Street for some retail therapy. The room was large and clean, with a few basic toiletries provided. The staff were polte and helpful, check in and check out went without any problems. We didn't eat or drink there but there is a nice cafe just across the road! A couple of negatives, wifi isn't included in the room rate, which we found as standard in most other hotels, and I found it a bit chilly in the shower because there was just a screen, no curtain or cubicle. Apart from those couple of minor things, we really enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, nice rooms - no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Poonya
Reviews.Content: The convenience of the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf can't be beat: at the end of the Powell-Mason line and in the middle of the Pier 39 and Ghirardelli Square area. This is a great place to base your SF sightseeing, whether walking, taking the cable car, or catching a bus. Lots to see and do and a huge number and variety if restaurants near-by. Rooms are modern, clean, and comfortable, and the restaurant serves a great breakfast (ours was comped because of some problems we had with our TV remote control). Great staff. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location...that is pretty much it”
Reviews.Author: sp4301
Reviews.Content: As with anything in San Francisco this is a relatively expensive hotel for the amenities you get. It is pretty basic, but comfortable. If you are bringing a car make sure you account for $45 + tax parking fee required here! Pluses = Clean, comfortable and extremely friendly staff. Great location, good restaurants and attractions within walking distance. Minuses = We never had our coffee supplies replenished, no clean cups or glasses were put in the room during our entire stay. The bathroom floor was dirty and never mopped up. $5 for each bottled water in the room. $12.95 for Wi-Fi (Really guys!). Parking fee, You have to weigh if staying within minutes of Fisherman's Wharf, a cable car stop and other attractions is worth the extra money for an average hotel... or do you want to save a few bucks, get a little more but have to drive more.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, beautiful amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Julie H
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Hyatt and overall, the experience was good. The staff was very friendly, especially the valet parking. The hotel was clean and our room was fresh and beautifully decorated in a modern design. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever had the opportunity to sleep in at a hotel with down comforters and pillows. It was very convenient to have the free use of the computer to print my boarding tickets for my flight the following day, however if you want to use the internet, there is a separate charge. The location is super as it is very close to Fisherman's Wharf and easy to walk to the cable cars, wharf, restaurants, shops, etc. We felt it was worth the $45 to pay for valet parking and not worry about our vehicle or have to search for a parking spot elsewhere. We happened to stay on a Friday night when a bicycle race was scheduled for the next morning and were rudely awakened at 5:00 a.m. by some idiot unloading long pipes from a truck as he was setting up for the race. He was clunking the pipes down on the sidewalk right under our window so we listened to the pipes clinking and clunking against each other and the concrete for an hour until I finally got out of bed and banged on the window until he noticed and finally stopped!!! We hadn't gotten to bed until 1:00 a.m. and had a long day of travel ahead of us so we were not very well rested for travelling!!

Reviews.Title: “Great area great value”
Reviews.Author: teach4u
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Couldn't do enough for you. Our inroom coffee pot did not work and within 15 min it was replaced. Only issue was in the bathroom. They ask you re use your towels but there is only one hook and no towel bar to let them dry! Also the in ceiling shower head was a little enemic. Would definately reccommend

Reviews.Title: “Nice, spartan hotel with noisy a/c units”
Reviews.Author: boothstar
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hyatt Fisherman's wharf couldn't be friendlier or more helpful. The hotel is very Asian in style, meaning quite clean, not fussy, almost spartan in style. We were there for a three-day conference. However, the first room had an air-conditioning unit that was so noisy that we had to move. The hotel moved us to a larger, nicer room, but the a/c unit was still so noisy that every time it turned on, we woke up. That made our work day quite difficult. We could have opened the windows, but the city traffic was even noisier. When they update this problem, this will be a very attractive hotel, well located.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient & well-kept”
Reviews.Author: TravelPixels
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend here & really enjoyed it. The hotel is just a short walk from the main strip of Fisherman's Wharf. Rooms were decorated in a really cool fashion & the hotel had good amenities. The reason I give it a 4 star instead of 5 is that in the first room we were put in, a couple was arguing next door, which we totally heard since it was a room with a connecting door. This wouldn't normally be a hotel issue, but we could hear the fight - & it was unsettling. In any case, we moved to another room (which was a hypoallergenic room) & then it was quiet. The gym is great here. Lots of equipment & well set up. 24 hours. We got breakfast included, which was next door in a restaurant. Very good buffet. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but not the worst either”
Reviews.Author: yabutravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night at the tail-end of a business trip. After 3 nights in a downtown hotel, I wanted a change of scenery, catch up with friends and walk around Fisherman's Wharf a bit since I haven't visited in over ten years. I used my points so the stay was fine for not having paid anything. But in hindsight, I could have saved the 15000 pts for a better Hyatt! Pros: The location is convenient and close to all the touristy spots like other reviews noted. Staff was nice and friendly and called to make sure I was ok even though I used the kiosk to check in. I received free wifi for my one night (included with pts). Cons: Halls are musty and dingy. The whole place is very dated and needs a makeover. The room itself was a bit better but still had that grungy feel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay even during crowded Fleetweek!”
Reviews.Author: casavaldez
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay here at least once a year to attend a conference that happens at this hotel. This time we stayed here for Fleetweek. The staff is always very friendly to us with any interaction we have. We requested an oversize room and we were accomodated. The downsides to this particular stay 1. Parking was full. We had to park about a block away in a public garage. 2. The pool was not really "heated" on the night we attempted to swim, but we have never had a problem with the pool on any previous stay. 3. The hotel claims that the restaurant located inside the hotel serves breakfast until 11am. However, because it is a sports bar and is was Sunday football, they stop serving off the menu at 10:30 on you can only dine on their very expensive buffet $20 per person. My kids and I would have a very hard time eating $20 of breakfast. We just went somewhere else and had a nice breakfast for half the price. Overall, we love to stay hear because of it's location. Once again, for Fleetweek, the location was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Not so nice”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuy2000
Reviews.Content: It really started with the protest that was going on out the front of the hotel. Employess were marching, holding signs and chanting "don't stay or eat at this hotel!" Apparantly this is quite a common occurance and has been going on for a number of years about the right to form a union? Anyway we were booked in so in we went. The (working) staff very nice and appogetic. We did our research on trip advisor and this was meant to be one of the best hotels to stay in around the Fishamans Wharf area. If that is the case then it must be the best of a bad bunch. Our family (me, wife 5yo & 9yo) were booked in for 3 nights. In short the rooms were small, tired, dirty and expensive. Also the hotel must be going through some needed renovations and our room was next to them so every 5 minutes we heard the rubble slidding down a 4 story shoot into a dump truck. So not ones to rest on our laurals we moved out after one night and booked another hotel near Union Square & China Town which was much, much better for the same price. While the hotel was very handy to Fishmans Wharf we found the whole area to be a rather unpleasant tourist trap. San Francisco is one of the would great cities which I really encourange people explore though I would only reccomend a brief vist to Fishermans Wharf (for short walk and perhaps a ferry ride) - you don't need to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: mbsef2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite with my spouse for a few nights and had a wonderful time. The staff was wonderful and very helpful at all times. The suite is well worth the price. It had a spacious living room with leather sofas and large screen tv. The master bedroom had a very comfortable bed with desk and large plasma. The bath was quite large as well. All in all a very pleasany stay. The location was great as it was in the heart of the wharf only footsteps away from everything. I would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Hyatt only in name”
Reviews.Author: eaglecreek
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this hotel was more than adequate for the purposes of our 3 night stay in San Francisco however if your expecting the same 4* standard that most associate with a Hyatt you will be dissapointed. Location is excellent to explore the city and the waters edge with lots of Restaurants and Bars nearby, my reccomendation would be to get a taxi to the Italian district where you will find some great dining at reasonable prices. The rooms are basic and if you are unlucky you can be up to 3 or 4 minutes walking from the lift to your room (a real maze). Parking is incredibly expensive and leaves a bitter taste when you check out. All in all I would say that this stay was poor value.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: alans1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in august and found it to be one of the dirtiest i have ever stayed in. The blinds were full of dust, the floor not vacumed properly, noisy aircon, airvents full of dust (i have pictures), the bath was dirty, corridors uncleaned in 3 days etc etc. The so called restaurant is open to the public. I do NOT think this is worth the money but thats only my opinion I emailed Hyatts complaints office to which it took two weeks for them to reply. This type of service is quite shocking for what is a world known chain

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: azure5707
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and makes it very easy to get around the city. It is very close to the pier and cable cars. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The bathroom in our room was a bit awkward as the door opened into the room. There was also no ventilation in the bathroom which made it difficult to use after a shower. There are lots of places to eat in the area (Scoma, Ghirardelli, great happy hour at the hotel bar).

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected at all!”
Reviews.Author: melbournetravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I often stay at Hyatt hotels when we travel and they usually have a very high standard - this one however was a huge exception!! We had booked for 7 nights..so you could imagine my horror when we walked into our room to find it was shabby, old, dark & lacking any form of luxury or warmth. No mini bar in sight..just a bed and a really old desk in the room. We were given a fantastic rate through a friend who works with the Hyatt..and even this super deal was not going to keep me staying in this room! And if I had been paying the full rate, I would have been furious!! The entire hotel is really old and is needing a renovation..even the hallways feel shabby & old and it just does not have the usual Hyatt feel about it. Luckily, when I phoned reception they were happy for us to cancel the other 6 nights and just stay the 1 night..which I did appreciate. Also, Fishermans Wharf is very touristy, dirty & tacky so I would recommend anyone visiting the area, to stay in the gorgeous Union Square and then just catch the cable car down to Fishermans Wharf for a look...you only need a few hours there at the most!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Tourist”
Reviews.Author: travo2010
Reviews.Content: My husbandâ€™s company booked the hotel for a business trip, and I met up with him. We were in a standard king room. The Good: Helpful and friendly staff, clean hotel, comfortable bed, cozy chaise lounge, small refrigerator. The Odd: Sliding bathroom door with a gap that didnâ€™t dampen any sound â€“ not a problem for us, but possibly uncomfortable for a shy bladder user. Shower had glass door that covered slightly more than 50% of the shower - the shower head was a square and was flush with the ceiling. Passed two rooms being vacuumed after 9pm, but didnâ€™t notice any noise after 10pm. Tips: Coffee maker is in a drawer in the closet area. Courtyard room facing away from street was quiet - occasionally (barely) heard a muffled fog horn. A Safeway is located two blocks from the hotel when you exit the main doors and turn right. Both the Wharf and Ghirardelli Square are within a short walking distance. Getting There: My Husband arrived the day before me, and took the Super Shuttle from the airport ($17). The driver honked and cursed, and he felt the van catch air a few times. I also took the Super Shuttle. My driver didnâ€™t curse, but he frequently used the horn on pedestrians, vehicles waiting for pedestrians, and random vehicles stopped or driving in front of him. There were inches (at best) between our van and the nearest obstacles. We took an uneventful cab ride back to the airport ($50).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: skyaa1
Reviews.Content: We chose the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf as our base for a three day exploration of San Francisco. It's a short five-minute walk from Fisherman's Wharf. The location is a major advantage because it's close enough to be very convenient but far enough to avoid the noise of late night visitors to the waterfront area. Since we were renting a car at the end of our stay, a bonus was a nearby Enterprise location (350 Beach St.). The bed was very comfortable and the room had a nice flatscreen TV. I usually stick to practical issues and avoid decor, but in this case, the two are related. The hotel's design is is very modern/minimalist, and though it was insignificant to us, some travelers may be put off by the lack of bathroom storage or towel racks. The staff was friendly, helpful, and responsive, always treating us like valued customers. The cost of parking is $45 a night and tax took the amount to over $50. Yeah, our eyes bugged out too, and we'd usually never spend that kind of money on parking...but when we weighed it against the time and expense of other transportation - $25-30 each for a hop-on/hop-off bus, multiple connections on public transit, etc, - we got our car a day early and sprung for one night of parking. This enabled us to make the rounds of several attractions we would have missed otherwise. If you do happen to arrive at the Hyatt in a vehicle, be aware that the driveway, which is more of a square paved courtyard, is often hectic and packed with vehicles. Bottom line: very nice hotel in a perfect location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for first time San Francisco visitors!”
Reviews.Author: Drydenite
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 4 night stay and very happy with our choice of accommodations. Location is fabulous, 2 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, all MUNI transit systems (bus, trolley, streetcar) within a block. Knuckle's sports bar serves a fabulous Cobb salad and with linens! Only downside, Internet was $10 / day so we visited our friendly neighborhood Starbuck's around the corner. Our room only had a large shower which was fine for us but if you like to soak in a tub, would be disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: TAE467
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights and thought it was just ok. The biggest disappointment was walking into the room and seeing two double beds. Every other hotel we had stayed at had King/Queen sized beds. I queried this with reception and was advised all the bigger beds were taken. Disappointing as it meant we had to sleep in separate beds for two nights! The hotel room was clean and tidy, but I would have expected free wi-fi in this day and age. Generally though, the hotel is good and we used it as a great base to explore the wharf and to walk up to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Foodie-Goodie0215
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my daughter and found the rooms very spacious, clean and accessible. The only negative comment I have was the lack of a universal socket for my laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Cool September Mornings on the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: raineyArdrossan
Reviews.Content: We stated at the Hyatt for 5 nights. The hotel is very close to all your wharf amenities. Be sure if you stay at this hotel that you ask for an inner room as some rooms face the streets and it does get quite noisy. Hotel room was clean, comfortable and the windows open for fresh air. The pillows were very soft. The quilt was cozy and warm. Bathroom clean and good size. My husband went down each morning to get us a couple of coffees from their resturant. Too bad there is no coffee maker in the room. I asked for a small fridge and it was delivered, although it looked like it was in a war zone, all pitted up. If the manager of this hotel saw what condition this small fridge was in , I'm sure he would have just given it away and replaced it with ones in better shape. The cart it came on was also quite dusty, so clean it. That was the only small complaints we had. Hotel is in walking distance to Breakfast places: I Hop, Denny's, American Breakfasts, etc. Also there is breakfast at Knuckles (Not sure why they named their resturant that?!) Mornings are cool in Sept. but days are quite warm. Buy your Wharf Pass and do the Hop on/Hop off. Very interesting and good for several days. Stop at the Sports Basement and buy sports items at a very reasonable price. Make use of the pass do get off and on. All in all the hotel was very good. Would stay again it minor changes were made.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: Tamlbrook
Reviews.Content: I'm sure the price reflected San Francisco, but we thought it was over priced. They had the coffee maker in a drawer so we didn't know it was there. Paid $10 for room service coffee. Pool area was nice and quiet

Reviews.Title: “Not up to my expectation”
Reviews.Author: bauwens
Reviews.Content: Clearly this is not a bad hotel. But it's clearly not the best Hyatt I have stayed at. Talking San Francisco, the Embarcadero Hyatt is clearly a better hotel. As to location, Fisherman's Wharf is just a huge tourist trap, and a pretty bad one at that. OK, one might want to give a look at Alcatraz, maybe, if there weren't so many tourists, walk along the coat. So, a short stop in the area might be OK, but why staying overnight in that area? (Only reason we ended up there was the conference that I attended and which I would have wished to go elsewhere). Anyway, in my book, location is a minus, not a plus. Rooms are OK, beds are nice. Hallways are long. Our shower, a disabled-accessible walk in shower, would have been nice if the flow rate would have been a bit higher and we could have moved it higher up. Our windows opened up on the courtyard, probably because we booked the cheapest rate, so I cannot really complain about that. However, on the second floor, it really felt like a basement suite. Restaurant is not a real restaurant and wine selection is very limited. First two selections that we ordered from the list turned out not to be available so we ended up with our third choice which was not great.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sarita00
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel, cause the one across the stree (holiday Inn Express) didn't have availabitity for all our stay, and i can only say it was far from a good experience. Staff at reception couldn't care less, one of them spoke English with such a strong Chinese accent, that it was almost impossible to understand him. We asked to have a shuttle booked for the aiport cause our flight was really early in the morning, and it was so complicated for them to organize it as if it was the 1st time someone requested that. The rooms were very well decorated, but that's what you expect from a Hyatt, wireless in the room was really expensive. The holiday Inn express across the road is much chepear as similiar room decoration, FREE internet,breakfast included and friendlier staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at the Hyatt.”
Reviews.Author: buddy011
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf. Service here is outstanding. Beds were so comfortable and rooms were super clean. Our room was also very quiet. Did not hear guests in other rooms which is a big plus when your trying to sleep. Only thing I was disappointed with was there was no fridge or microwave in the room. They should add these 2 items and it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: courtneyAlcoa
Reviews.Content: Rooms were average, nothing special. Hall carpets were dirty and needed some attention. Check -in was OK. We didn't get 2 beds as requested, but they changed our room the following morning as requested. What makes this hotel attractive is the location. You can walk to the sights or ride the trolley. We didn't have a car, but parking is quite expensive at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Nikewife
Reviews.Content: We brought our 10 year old son to San Francisco for the first time and decided staying on the Wharf would be a good location. We were very happy with our choice! The staff was friendly, valets quick and professional and the room was a nice size. We even took a dip in the cute private courtyard pool! Location was our main motivation and we were not disappointed. A few minutes' walk to Pier 39 and a bit longer to the Alcatraz launch pier. We had a rental car and took it in and out of the valet multiple times. Try Knuckles (the attached restaurant)!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city - so much to do”
Reviews.Author: NewsTracker
Reviews.Content: Hyatt is definitely one of the best hotels on Fishermans Wharf and usefully back from the tourist trap Wharf itself. Good rooms, decent size, well furnished and equipped. "Knuckles" bar is good - although the menu limited and the drinks expensive. Pool is shallow, but it is heated - a must as SanFran is never hot.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but lacking”
Reviews.Author: cls38950
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations (2) months in advance and we showed up at 4pm the day we were scheduled to check in. We were tired and ready to freshen up from traveling all day with the kids. They told us our room would not be ready for another hour!!! They explained they needed time to put in the requested fridge and crib(we requested 2 months ago). We ate in our travel clothes and made due with the hotel restaurant, Knuckles, which is nothing but overpriced mediocre bar food. We finally are provided the keys to our room and much to our dismay, the crib and fridge were not in there. We had to wait another half hour to hour for those items and our luggage to be brought up(they said they would bring it up prior to our arrival in the room). We had tickets to the 6pm baseball game and all these delays made us incredibly late, ruining a lot of our baseball experience. no discounts offered for the inconveniences... The room was pretty clean. The staff friendly. The upgraded decor made the place more enjoyable. The pool is outside and while it is supposed to be heated, was still freezing and only one small hot tub. Oh, and there are no views of the golden gate bridge from any of the rooms, that picture is fake.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: BrianW1979
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. It's within walking distance of the Fisherman's Wharf and many restaurants. I arrived at the hotel early, and was allowed to check-in at 8 a.m. The staff was very polite. When I needed assistance, it was easy to get help from the staff with no wait. Both the room and the bathroom were very spacious. The bed was very comfortable. Rooms were in pristine condition. Knuckles, the on-site restaurant was very reasonably priced and had great food. The only thing keeping my from giving this hotel a 5-star rating is that it lacks the "Wow factor."

Reviews.Title: “Great location, strange hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetskist
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, Leslie was very helpful at the front desk. The rooms are not soundproof because we heard a little, â€œyipperâ€� dog from the hallway and from our room. We had asked for a quiet room and selected this hotel because they did not allow pets. It was our first night, and we were very tired from traveling. I called the front desk and was told they would let the manager know. They said dogs were not allowed. After an hour of intermittent barking, I went down to the front desk. They asked if the barking was on tv! It appeared the manager knew nothing about it. The manager then went to the room next door and freaked the dog out. He later called our room and said someone was picking up the dog. We never heard it again! They had made a note about it and asked about the situation when we checked out. We got an old-fashioned, classic-style shower with a bit of mold in the tiles and on the curtain. The only towel racks in the bathroom are in the shower. The toilet paper holder is in a hard to reach position. The toilet seat slides around too much. The door to the bathroom opens out into the room and always seems to be in the way. Leaving a couple dollars on the pillow with a note results in a lot of extra towels/washcloths. Heads up for an awkward turn down service if youâ€™re not expecting it. Our door was slightly open when we came back one evening. Thinking it might be a robber, we cautiously entered only to find a female employee placing chocolates on our pillows. Unless you lock the safe, it will bang each time you close the closet door. There is no place to set your luggage other than on the floor. There are not enough functioning outlets. The desk and nightstand contain decoy outlets that do not work for American electronics. There is only one elevator that stops on the lobby floor. It is not big enough for all the guests and luggage. You will have to walk up the lobby stairs if you get one of the east elevators. I signed up for the free Hyatt Gold Passport to use one of the two computers and printer that makes up the small â€œbusiness center.â€� Otherwise we would have had to pay. Front desk staff has to log you on each time, and it counts down from an hour. It seems odd to have to pay to temporarily use a computer. Take a walk a few blocks down the street, past the nice bums, to get some food + beverages from the Safeway. It is a bit far to carry a 24-pack of water, but it is well worth the money you save not opening the bottles in the room. Pool closes promptly at 9:00 pm, even if you just got your swimsuit on! They also kicked out all the adults in the hot tub. This is too early. Very comfortable beds & bedding; pillows were a bit too soft. We ate at the restaurant Knuckles once. FYI, you must sit at the bar for happy hour. The portions are very big, so be prepared to split a meal. My lemonade was â€œbalancedâ€� with electrolytes and cost $5.50. Upon departure, we got a quick airport shuttle for $16 per person from the guy watching the tiny parking lot. There were no taxis to take us to the BART station due to a convention. (On the way in from the airport, we took the BART for $8.10 each and then paid about $9 + tip for a taxi.) Overall, this was a great location, but we will probably stay at another hotel in the Warf next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value for money and service”
Reviews.Author: kentishmayde
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, has everything you need, rooms a little small but this is a city hotel. Valet parking excellent, reasonable price and quick service. All staff friendly and helpful. On site dining limited menu but good VFM and quality of food excellent. Only complaint is cost of the internet connection - very slow connection for the price - I used the business tariff as I had JPG files to send - took forever.......free printing of boarding passes via reception though. Great location minutes from the wharf and the cable cars, would recommend and return if ever in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Not entirely up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: davesbet
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my wife, daughter and 15 yr old grandson we booked two rooms for four nights (Aug 4th through 7th). Check-in went smoothly and the valet parking was efficient (although at $50/day we thought it should have been). Both rooms were satisfactory, although ours was smaller than we are used to. We had requested a larger double for my daughter and grandson and they had no complaints. My wife was disappointed that our room lacked a tub, something she needs after touring with a bad back. Since the pool/hot tub was on our floor my why decided that would compensate. Early the first morning she went to the pool (outdoors) to do her water aerobic exercises and then soak in the hot tub. The pool was unattended but with the help of a guest she found a towel. There were three young people in the tub who lefty rather hurriedly. When my wife finished her excerises she found the tub filled with what appeared to be soap bubbles so she passed on it. The next morning the bubbles were gone but, a young woman in high heels came in, stripped to a bikini, entered the tub, and appeared to be washing off her make-up. My wife passed on it again. This is not exactly the Hyatt's fault and is a reason some people will not ever go into any public hot tub. A visit to Alcatraz was at the top of my daughter's to do list and she was very disappointed to find all of the tours booked for the period that we were there. As soon as we checked in we went to the concierge to see what she could do. At first she found an opening for Sunday but, later discovered that was a mistake. A few days later my grandson overheard a concierge in Ghiardellii Square day that anyone could get tickets the same day by simply showing up early at the ferry. Apparently everyone in the area knew this except the concierge of the Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf. In order to make her trip to the island on Sunday my daughter packed on Saturday night and left us to take care of her luggage and check-out on Sunday. No problem, except after a half-hour wait the bell-man never showed up and I made two trips down by myself. At checkout, when asked about our stay I said that it was just satisfactory for the reasons above. The young woman apologised and removed the parking charges from our bill. This is the first time that I felt the Hyatt lived up to its reputation and a good enough reason to give it another star. During our stay we ate at the hotel's sports bar type restaurant one night and felt that the food was good and reasonably priced. The location is excellent with a cable car terminus right behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: mford1980
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights in May, over memorial weekend. It's a great location, had a great price, and an extremely comfortable room. As a "room snob" I'm always nervous when we book on discount sites, but this place won.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service I have ever experienced in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrOwl08
Reviews.Content: We were guests at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf for a couple's weekend to SFO in March, and returned at the end of a family vacation in August. In both instances, the Hyatt staff proved to be the very best I have ever encountered. We did not request anything unusual--a firmer pillow, concierge recommendations, bag storage--but these routine services were always met with unfailing courtesy. This staff even checks back with you to make sure you were satisfied with whatever service they provided--true professionalism! I suppose that I should mention that the hotel is located within a few blocks of the Wharf, North Shore eateries, the trolley line to Chinatown, and boasts all of the creature comforts that you would expect from a Hyatt. A great location and top-tier rooms to go with an outstanding staff! It means a pretty penny, but I will make every effort to stay here on future trips to the Bay Area.

Reviews.Title: “A real find in San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: MisterOpinion
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hyatt as all the main bigger hotels downtown and in the Union Square area were full due to a convention. What a pleasant surprise! This is a very neat, compact hotel in the Fisherman's Wharf area - which in reality is only a short ride from downtown (by taxi or cable car for those with a bit of time!).
