Staff at reception were very switched on. This is not an elaborate hotel, but is very functional and exceptionally well maintained. My room was comfortable and spacious, spotless bathroom, with the feeling this was a few steps up from the usual 4 star kind of property. Frankly the sister Hyatt hotels in the Financial district and Union Square, along with the Hilton and whatever the Pan Pacific now calls itself are all VERY ordinary. Breakfast was in their lovely loft-like cafe with again, charming service. While I may have ended up at this location by accident - I'd very likely return - if the price were still as good. The combination of business and leisure travellers provioed a nice atmosphere too! On departure I took the airport mini-bus from right outside the hotel's front door. Defintely consider this hotel when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, pretty good stay but a few niggles”
Reviews.Author: Poliwhirl
Reviews.Content: A couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and two tram lines close by which take you to downtown (Union Square) - note that a single tram fare to downtown is an incredible $6 so a return trip for three people was $36! I suggest one tram trip for the novelty factor and then use taxis (fare to downtown is about $10) or I think you can get a SF public transport pass for your stay which includes the trams and would work out cheaper if you are intent on moving around SF. Anyway back to the hotel review ... Friendly and helpful check-in, valets/bellhops helpful/friendly too. Rooms nicely decorated but lacking refridgerator although a small one cup coffee maker is provided. Air conditioning in room was noisy at times. Beds clean and comfortable. Nice toiletries. There is no free wifi at the hotel either in the rooms or in the lobby - the charge for 24hrs is $10. With so many hotels now providing this free, Hyatt are well behind the curve, to avoid the charge i walked down the street and sat outside the holiday inn and conected to their free network to download emails and check facebook. Valet parking charge is exortionate (can't remember exactly how much but it was too much!). 'Business Center' is two pc's in an alcove which I had to wait a while to use (you have to pay to use thse although you get free 20 minutes or so to certain airline websites so that you can do online check-in and print boarding passes). Pool is OK and even the sun came out when we used it! Didn't sample breakfast as not included in room rate, Would I stay again? Probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flatliner3544
Reviews.Content: Booked the 2 Double Bed room through Hyatt's website at a nightly rate of $228.65. Opted for a quiet room located at the back of the hotel. It was indeed very quiet. Nice and dark at night as well. Spent four nights there. Very comfortable and clean. Very happy with the place. Had two breakfasts there - both a la carte. The first, corned beef hash and benedicts, was excellent and a very good welcome to the city; the second, bacon and eggs, felt like it came from the buffet. Disappointing. Had dinner there one night - nachos, quesadilla and skins. Amazing! Some of the best food of the whole three week tour. Decent bar as well. The restaurant is decked out like a very basic hotel restaurant which is a shame. Re-modelling it with booths would make it feel more up-market. The hotel is located two blocks back from Fisherman's Wharf, which suited us - the wharf area is not our cup of tea, but you're close to all the tourist bits. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: broadwaterannie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location with very welcoming and helpful staff. The beds are super comfortable and rooms very clean. We had breakfast each day in Knuckles and although the buffet is standard and acceptable the choices on the menu are excellent. I did not expect a lot from Knuckles after reading previous reviews but we found it perfect for breakfast, a late dinner or a drink at the end of the evening. Close to the cable cars and the bustle of Fisherman's Wharf the Hyatt is an ideal base for sightseeing and if we are ever lucky enough to return to beautiful San Francisco we will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great If You Can Walk the Maze to Your Room/ Bad if You Want Free Wireless”
Reviews.Author: emmamikah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt this past week and found the following: We traveled with a 20 year old child and we enjoyed the location which was terrific. The hotel was very quiet, something rare in San Francisco. The decor was simplistic, nothing special at all that would suggest you are paying top dollar for the hotel. The customer service was very, very good. The buffet breakfast was good if you don't eat the fake tasting eggs and get an omelette made to order instead..the rest was very, very good and high quality. The concierge was was helpful. The beds were terrific, the garbage cans were a joke, enough to put in a tissue box practically. It's amazing that hotels that charge more make you pay for internet service while across the street The Holiday Inn was less money and did not charge for internet..go figure. The more expensive the hotel the worse the toileties smell I have found...true here at the Hyatt. Given all of this I would go back if I could afford it again. San Francisco's hotels don't look as wonderful as those from other cities. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are beautiful, but not designed well”
Reviews.Author: ericdux
Reviews.Content: Itâ€™s obvious as soon as you enter the guest room at the Hyatt Fishermanâ€™s Wharf that theyâ€™ve spent a lot of money making the rooms modern and sleek. Flat screen TV, stylish furniture, aesthetic bathroom, even an iHome iPod clock radio all contribute to a visual delight, sure to appease the well traveled or weary guest seeking the comforts of a modern home. But when you actually start DOING things in the room, you quickly find itâ€™s a case of design for its own sake and not for meeting peopleâ€™s needs or goals. First, Iâ€™ll get this out of the way. The TV was a snazzy touch, but I didnâ€™t turn it on once during my four days. In San Francisco, thereâ€™s way too much to do to have time to watch TV. That said, had I wanted to watch TV, I would have been hard-pressed to watch any channel containing the number 7. OK, where to start. How about the iHome clock radio. The clock was set 10 minutes fast, so I thought Iâ€™d be able to easily adjust the time. Bad assumption. I scoured every surface of the device more than once and could not find a single control to set the time. Is was not until my last night, when, obsessed with figuring it out, I started to turn a small thumbscrew on the back. As the screw loosened, so did a metal plate underneath it. And then, voila, the plate came off, revealing the controls to set the time. Why? Why hide these BASIC components of a clock? I just donâ€™t get it. More on the clock. I docked my iPhone before bed, noted that it was charging, then went to sleep. In the morning, my iPhoneâ€™s power was at 10%. Sometime in the night, it simply stopped charging. Then I noticed an outlet in the base of the nightstand lamp. Great! A feature of the room I can use. But no, the outlet was astonishingly too large for the standard prongs of an iPhone charger. Thatâ€™s right â€“ something with standard prongs kept slipping out of an outlet. So, pretty much the whole nightstand area was a fail, unless you count its ability to keep my phone and glasses off the floor. The bed and pillows themselves were really rather comfortable. But they stack the bed with a pyramid of shams that I prefer to not use. (I mean, who elseâ€™s heads have been on there, and do they really change the shams?) So, I piled them up on a chic chaise lounge. Next day, housekeeping mounted them again on the bed. So I again piled them on the chaise. Finally it seemed housekeeping got the hint, and for the remainder of the stay kept the sham sculpture on the chaise. Now, we move on to the bathroom, which was beautiful but was a calamity of uselessness. It packs more usability issues per square foot than should be permissible by law. After an evening of traveling to get to the hotel, I had to, uh, empty the bladder. I literally jumped back and yelped when I flushed. It was one of those suction-type toilets that could probably suck down a toddler. The effect was startling. And, grossly, it splashed drops of toilet water all over the place. Ick. From then on, I learned to shut the lid before flushing, lest I get splashed or inadvertently sucked down. And when youâ€™re finished sitting on the toilet, it really helps to have taken some yoga classes so that you can reach the toilet paper. The holder is about a foot off the floor, and placed behind the toilet. Itâ€™s a terribly awkward twist, and I was seriously worried about pulling a back muscle. Why put it there, when higher up and on the other side is an unused wooden faÃ§ade of the vanity? Letâ€™s talk about brushing your teeth or taking a pill. When I do these things, I prefer using a cup or glass for the water. Yet in this 21st century bathroom, I could not find a cup. I did finally see them in the main living area, seated in front of the $5 bottles of Aquafina. Why put the glasses there? If Iâ€™m going to spend $5 on a bottle, Iâ€™m going to drink it from the little thingy they designed on the bottle to fit my mouth. Put the glasses where people are going to need them â€“ near the bathroom sink. I purposely left my used glass sitting near the sink. When housekeeping came, they removed that glass and gave me a clean one â€“ near the bottled waters. Eventually I tried a trick and left my toothbrush in the glass. Housekeeping left that one alone, but still replaced the missing part of the glass couple near the bottled water. Water glasses The shower was unfortunately not exempt from being almost unusable. First thing I did was try to grab the glass shower door knob so that I could slide the door to the left and reach the shower controls. But oh, how the door did not budge. Then I paid closer attention and noticed that the door was not really a door, but a glass panel that was affixed to the ceiling and the base. The door sliding knob was really just something to hang a towel on. But metal knob on glass doorâ€¦thatâ€™s an affordance Iâ€™m used to everywhere else in the world. It makes the door slide back and forth. Soâ€¦I had to get into the shower in order to turn on the shower. This might not be as much of a problem if it were a traditional shower where I could run the water in the bottom, get it to the right temperature, and then set the diverter to shower mode. The problem with this fancy shower is that the water sprayed down from a square plate-looking object in the center of the ceiling. So the very instant that the water is turned on, itâ€™s raining down on your arm â€“ whether or not youâ€™ve managed to instantly find the right temperature. So, for me, that meant getting doused with ice cold water on my arm, then having to either reach through the cold rain or sneak my arm around it to adjust it warmer. By my fourth day, I kind of figured out how to get close to the right temperature in a split second and then withdraw my arm before the water totally got me. Thing is, I shouldnâ€™t have to learn these kinds of tricks. Then, we run into the problem of the water coming straight down from overhead. It makes cleaning certain body parts that are, say, on the underneath sides of ourselves rather impossible. I found myself performing certain ballet moves or yoga positions to try to get the water to reach the right places. Oh, itâ€™s great for hair and shoulder washing. But pretty useless for everything else. Square shower sprayer Oh, and because the shower door isnâ€™t a door at all, water splashes all over the floor and even onto the bathroom door (which is a double pocket door, not one with a knob, and I never could get the two panels to meet in the middle; good thing I was solo). Opening to shower If you use the hotel soap and leave it in the wire soap dish, the next day, it has bluish grill marks on it. If you have wet things â€“ as I did, having come from a whitewater rafting trip and had two wet swim suits, water socks, water shirt â€“ forget trying to hang them anywhere, as there arenâ€™t any towel bars (except for one in the shower that they use to hang the bath mat towel). Thereâ€™s that shower door knob, plus a twin knob mounted inside the shower door. But thatâ€™s it. The Hyattâ€™s modern bathroom places all of the towels in cubbies. Iâ€™m not sure what a family of four would do after swimming in the hotel pool. How would they dry four swim suits? And how about four towels? If the Hyatt wants me to conserve by reusing my towels, shouldnâ€™t there be a place to hang them? Iâ€™ve stayed at some lesser hotel chains that have a retractable line in the shower that you can pull out to hang your wet things. Remember that outlet that was too large for the prongs of a standard charger? Same thing in the bathroom. One of the two outlets was too large for the prongs of the hair dryer or electric razor cord. Simply bizarre. Iâ€™m sure there are other details Iâ€™m leaving out, such as their placing the coffee maker not by the source of water but instead hiding it in a dresser drawer that I came to use for my socks. If I think of them, Iâ€™ll fill them in later. Sitting near the TV was a book titled â€œWelcome Home.â€� Feeling curious, I opened it, thinking it was the guest services directory. Instead, with delicious irony, I discovered it to be a catalog of the all the chic items that you can purchase. If you liked all the useless accoutrements so much during your stay, why not buy them for everyday use at hyattathome.com? I say go for it. Just make sure to hone up your yoga skills ahead of time. Post Script At the bar, I asked the bartender to describe Alaskan Amber. He said "It's an amber beer." Wow, really? The morning I checked out, I called the front desk to request a taxi. They sold me on their limo service for $55 including tip. I went down, printed my boarding pass and waited for the limo. Then, the front desk told me the limo was in an accident, and Iâ€™d need to take a taxi after all. The 20-minute difference (had they just called the cab for me to begin with) nearly caused me to miss my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient...great event staff...but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: EfficientTraveler
Reviews.Content: Had a business conference there for 3 days. The event staff was great, and went out of their way to help, even ordering me special beers in the bar for my group. It seemed a little pricey, but we were near the wharf for peak tourist season. Convenient to fisherman's wharf..only a few blocks away. Cable car stop immediately behind hotel also quite convenient and shorter lines! I really like the location. My room unfortunately faced the street and it was rather noisy from traffic early in the mornings. The pool was relatively small and crowded, but it was peak tourist season. The room was ok; large window and large bathroom. Comfortable bed, coffee maker, refrigerator. Biggest problem was their computer system went down on Monday, so none of my attendees could get a bill from the hotel, and it took them till Friday to reconcile mine. In general, the hotel was clean, but the carpet in the hallways didn't seem to ever be vacuumed. The elevators are a little inconvenient, since you have to go downstairs a half a flight to get to the main bank of elevators. Since there's only 5 floors, they were fast, though!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: natty13
Reviews.Content: Staff was great. Very helpful, one block from the wharf. Will definately say again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Snowmann42
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our experience at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf. We stayed four nights in a top floor interior Business room. The room was quiet (very important to us), spacious and comfortable. Service was excellent, uniformly. Staff members were well trained, courteous, and responsive. They were quite knowledgeable about their hotel and about their city. We did not eat in the restaurant. The hotel is well located, near Fisherman's Wharf, cable cars, and Ghirardelli Square. For strong walkers, most of the tourist sights are accessible on foot; we walk to Union Square, the Embarcadero, even the South of Market area. However, most visitors will want to take public transportation to those areas. Hotel parking is quite expensive, but the hotel staff were happy to recommend alternative parking sites. Look for packages that include breakfast or free valet parking. Top floor interior rooms are quietest, but pool noise can be distracting during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Austravellersx4
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at this hotel recently and it was great. From a very pleasant and efficient check in, to breakfast in the cafe, the concierge, and afternoon drinks in the bar this was a most pleasant experience. We particularly note one of the barmen, Clayton, who was efficient and fun. The only thing that was unfortunate was that the hotel rooms can only have 2 beds (we asked our travel agent to request a rollaway for one of our boys before we left), howevr city regulations don't allow more than 2 beds in each room. As a city regulation there wasn't much the hotel could do, albeit they were very helpful giving us extra bedding (which we used to make up an extra bed for one of our kids). Sorry we didn't spend more than 3 nights in SF, will definately be back, and certainly stay again at the Hyatt Fishermans Wharf. Other tips - hire bikes and ride across the Golden gate to the bay-side town (beautiful), then get the ferry back; Also get to Cafe Pesce (Italian Restaraunt), a block from the Hyatt, we did 2/3 nights there!. Fantastic and thanks, Clayton and other management & staff at Hyatt FW!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice and great location”
Reviews.Author: Jez533
Reviews.Content: Great location for accessing everything around Fishermans Wharf. A fairly standard hotel which is good value for a family if you can manage to get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malt661521
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Francisco for 5 nights at the Hyatt. They were very helpful especially when the first room we checked had a horrible smoke smell. Unfortunately, for the hotel, guests in the room were smoking in a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor. The manager was helpful and switched rooms immediately. A very central location to all. Our room was near the pool, which was loud in the morning since families were in the hot tub at 7 am, but other wise a good experience. The housekeeping staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: skinnycat77
Reviews.Content: Loved the location- away from a lot of the street noise. Kids enjoyed the pool and my husband and I enjoyed the hot tub after a long day of sight seeing. Rooms were nice and beds were SUPER comfortable! Within walking distance to everything. The only reason I did not rate it excellent was the price. It is a bit pricey than other hotels in the area. Staff was VERY friendly and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, big rooms, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Betsie
Reviews.Content: We were there in november. We arrived late at night, we had no problem checking in fast. Greeted by very nice staff. Hotel is close to Pier 39, a little bit off the main touristic attractions, but, hey, you have a good reason to take the cable car! Otherwise, very well deserved by public transit. Rooms are clean and big and new!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBlonde
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, awesome dining and they restaurant staff really knows their wines. The rooms were super, and I received helpful service from everyone. The shopping in the area was t-shirt touristy, so you'll need to plan on driving or walking many city blocks, but since that doesn't matter to me too much I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for typical Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: CT5kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hyatt as it was walking distance to the Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, and waterfront. It was very clean with an excellent front desk staff. Our fifth floor room had a coffee maker (one thing most Hyatts lack) and a coin operated washer/dryer in the ice room/vending area. This is a must for a family of 5 doing some beach days. The negatives were the $45/night valet parking fee, the dark room (lighting was insufficient for reading away from the beds), and expensive breakfast (altho' Boudin's bakery and some decent Mexican spots were nearby for breakfast). For San Francisco, this Hyatt made a great base for a family to explore from and easily cable car return to.. Watch the entrance; our GPS took us past the valet entrance on North Point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cabotoy
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the location. We were able to walk to dinner and rent bicycles as well. Very spacious rooms with a comfortable bed. Excellent service. Loved the on site sports bar. Would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RhondaBeth12
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff Very clean Food great Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: holidayers007
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Pier 39 and 33 (Alcatraz Tour) Hotel was flawless. Staff was friendly and helpful Immaculate Service. Would stay here again. Valet parking was a little pricey but it was in and out 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: ca_lovers
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hyatt and It turned out to be a good choice. Had to stay in the Hilton a couple blocks further for a night and that was ready for an upgrade. Friendly staff, but it was not as lively, older furniture, closed bar, ... The Hyatt, with it's stylish restaurant and wine bar is definitely ranked higher for me. Close to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli, cable car station, Pier 39, ... Excellent location for exploring San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: Eiffel4
Reviews.Content: PROS: Friendly, accommodating staff, outdoor pool/hot tub, excellent location...2-3 blocks from Wharf, tour departures, restaurants, cable cars, Walgreens, and anything else you'd need CONS: Terrible lighting (even with all shades open), small (but to be expected with cost of real estate in Bay Area), sewer smell at lobby and elevator bay (we noticed windows were open and cleaning people were spraying Febreeze a lot, but still), bathroom doors slide/don't lock, very noisy if you're facing any of the streets (this is with windows closed), internet is not included in room rate ($10/day), there is no water in vending machines (only option is the $5 bottle in your room)

Reviews.Title: “Decent quality in the Fisherman's Wharf area”
Reviews.Author: AvidHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: LOCATION & FACILITIES: 3 Â½ /5: At Fishermanâ€™s Wharf, you are within easy walking distance of good restaurants, Pier 39, the Alcatraz Ferry and the cable car stop. However, I think itâ€™s a bit of a shame that there are also a number of lower quality tat / souvenir shops in the area (fortunately, not the same street as the Hyatt) which detract from the nicer establishments a little. We asked to be moved from the first bedroom we were given as it was next to a fairly busy road â€“ the last thing we needed as we adjusted to the time difference was traffic noise preventing us from getting to sleep! Our 2nd room didnâ€™t have a view but was quiet â€“ indeed, we switched off the AC and opened a window instead! It took me a couple of days to understand the layout of the hotel but itâ€™s a like an enormous square-cornered figure of eight. So, if you imagine all the rooms facing out of the 8 are on the roadside, and all facing in are either above the outdoor pool or just a central atrium. SERVICE: 4/5: Reception, concierge, housekeeping and restaurant staff were all cheerful, pleasant and helpful. ROOMS: 3 Â½ /5: Decorated in a contemporary, slightly business-like design, spacious and clean, with AC, TV. (One tiny negative â€“ we found the bed a bit soft â€“ fine for the first couple of nights, but after 7 nights, we were pleased to move on!) RESTAURANT: 3/5: We never tried breakfast in the hotel â€“ we had some early starts for tours and tended to go and fetch coffee and muffins from Starbucks (a block away, next to the cable car stop) instead! The Hollywood cafÃ© over the road does fabulous breakfasts too! Try the fresh fruit and pancakes â€“they were amazing â€“ and the plateful kept us going all day! We ate our evening meal twice in the Hyattâ€™s restaurant. It was easy to use it on the night we arrived, and also another evening when it was chilly and we didnâ€™t want to stray far. Food quality was good, but nothing fantastic. THINGS TO DO IN THE LOCALE: Where do I start?! When we started looking at visiting California, I didnâ€™t know how to divide our time, but San Francisco and the surrounding area has so much to see and do! We stayed there 7 nights, but you could easily stay more! We took a bus tour of the city, walked across the Golden Gate bridge, marvelled at the â€œcrookedâ€� street, and took (long!) trips out to Yosemite National Park and Napa valley (to sample the vineyards!). The shopping is amazing around Union Square, the Golden Gate park is huge and lovely, and itâ€™s worth spending time at Pier 39 and Chinatown. I also booked a hotel with an outdoor pool because I wanted to make sure that we could relax for an hour or two IF the weather was good enough, and I do think that was a bonus. SUMMARY: There are a number of 3 / 3Â½ * hotels in the area â€“ eg. Holiday Inn Express, Radisson, Sheraton etc - and the Hyatt is absolutely fine for a base. Like I say, you have plenty within 5-10 minutes walking distance, and you can also hop on a cable car to get to Union Square (for shopping) and the other city-centre sights. Hotels in the city centre donâ€™t tend to have outdoor space with a swimming pool, hence my reason for choosing Fishermanâ€™s Wharf â€“ and the Hyatt scores the highest on Trip Advisor in that area. Rooms in San Francisco are not cheap and this one was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: DES32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. The location is great for Fishermanâ€™s Whalf with all the main attractions in the area being a short walk away. The hotel and rooms are of a high standard and are very quiet. The concierge and guest services were extremely helpful with dinner reservations, recommendations and other requests. I would certainly stay here over down town if you are visiting on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Service”
Reviews.Author: libertycdamac
Reviews.Content: We just stayed five nights at this hotel. My husband was presenting at a conference and teenage kids and I â€œplayedâ€™ in San Francisco. ALL the staff was very friendly. The beds were very comfortable and we had an excellent view. Room was very clean and housekeeping did an excellent job daily on cleaning the room. I have not complaints about this hotel. It is an excellent location and an excellent stay. We had breakfast for two of us each morning which included eggs, pancakes, sausages, oatmeal, and fresh fruit. The service in the restaurant was lacking but the food was good. If you donâ€™t have breakfast included in the stay there is a restaurant across the street that was always busy that served breakfast They have a pool and spa. The days were cool so we only went swimming one day. The pool was clean about 80 degrees. Hot tub was nice and clean and temp. was about 102. We used the laundry that was located on each floor of the hotel. Cost $1.50 for wash and $2.00 for drying. The most difficult part of this was finding the washer and dryer available. There is a Safeway, Trader Joes, and World Market located within two blocks of the hotel. This hotel is located only two blocks from MANY choices of restaurants and fast food. Subway, In and Out, Boudin, and so many others to list. We ate at Scomaâ€™s, and Hillstone mult. times just because the food was excellent. No refrigerator or microwave in the room but it was worth eating out daily because the food was so excellent down there. Parking is expensive no matter where you go. It is $45 a day with in and out privileges. The bell staff took excellent care of us and our car. We parked the car and took taxiâ€™, trolley and the bus to most of the tourist sites. Most we paid was $20 to get to the Golden Gate Bridge. Recommend if you wish to see Alcatraz you get reservations on line early. They were sold out the week we were there so I was thankful for the advice ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Fisherman's Wharf district”
Reviews.Author: KaITrAvEL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights while visiting San Francisco. The service, rooms, the hotel is up to the name of the prestigious hotel chain. In this case accompanied by the excellent location to visit San Francisco. Five minute walk to Pier 39 and shopping. Two minutes walk from the tram line Powell - Mason. Two minutes walk to the San Francisco Maritime Park. Ten minutes walk to Pier 33 to visit Alcatraz island. Although Little Italy is easily accessible on foot. The experience is recommended. When we'll come back to San Francisco, we'll also come back to Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf .

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: wpgcpl
Reviews.Content: Spent one night on business. Location great for tourists but not for people who have been to San Fran many times already, the area is a bit of a tourist trap. Rooms are spacious and beds comfortable. Flat screens with HD! My a/c didn't work, but wasn't a big deal. Attached pub/restaurant offered good food and happy hour beer prices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter25
Reviews.Content: the location is unbeatable, corner of the cable car station, two blocks to Fishermans Wharf, walking distance to the italian quarter. The hotel is new , clean and modern, We splurged on a deluxe room and got the 5th floor corner room which was unbelievable. Very spacious, amazing views, marble bathroom. The service in the hotel is unbelievable, they go above and beyond what is needed, Bellservice is prompt and helpful. The adjoining restaurant is ok, if you get in late or it is raining it is a decent place to have a bite. I would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: withak66
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Francisco and was advised by several friends not to stay in the Fisherman's wharf area. I chose to ignore their recs and stayed at the Hyatt. The location was two blks from the wharf. We opted not to rent a car for our three day stay and took a shuttle from the airport to the hotel We headed to Yosemite for two nights and booked through carrentals.com great price and the car pick-up was a blk away on Beach street. There was a Starbucks on the corner behind the hotel adjacent to where you can get the trolley. Plenty of restaurants and shopping within a short walk. Do recommend the wine tasting at Cellar 360 at Ghiradelli square. Beautiful space, knowledgeable and friendly staff and a nice way to spend two hours. Also did the GO-Car tour. ( those funny little yellow cars you'll see buzzing around.. we initially laughed at the sight but were so glad we did as it was fun, navigated and narrated. We got to see alot and it only took two hours.

Reviews.Title: “Other less expensive hotels in same great location”
Reviews.Author: SammiMacC
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a really great location just a few blocks from the Wharf. We were looking for a hotel that would be comfortable, clean and close to all the attractions we wanted to visit and this hotel meet all of our criteria. If I were to visit San Fran again, I donâ€™t know if I would stay because the Holiday Inn Express is literally right across the street in the same great location. I might stay there next time to save money since we were hardly in the hotel with the many things to do. The location was our favorite thing about the hotel and the restaurant Knuckles downstairs was convenient when after a long day of walking around the city you want to just grab a quick bite to eat with no fuss. It is more of a sports bar/diner set up, but if you have a large group they have a few booths available with individual TV's to watch games. The room was clean and a decent size. No dresser, so only a closet to hang stuff. Bed was comfortable with lots of pillows. The hallways made the hotel seem older and a little dingy, but the rooms were much nicer. The check-in downstairs is impressive and the staff was helpful. A room up against the street would probably be loud, we had a room on the 5th floor overlooking the pool which was much quieter but I could hear kids in the pool in the early morning. They charge $40.00 for parking, but if you take your car to The Anchorage shopping area and speak to one of the parking tenants they gave us a hotel deal which was $25.00 per night-much better. Also, bring an umbrella-we stayed in late June and it rained, They Hyatt rents out umbrellas but they were all taken, so we stopped at a little shop around the corner for some cheap ones. Starbucks, Walgreens and World Market, Trader Joes....all within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: cybergal5184
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here. Staff was pleasant and was able to check us in quite early with no hassle. No fee for storing our bags until the room was ready. Our room faced the pool which was a bit strange as it was very crowded due to unseasonably warm weather. Beds were fine ... not great. Bathroom was the only down point. It is modern but not really as functional as it could be.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: darlingbelge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights end June - hotel was very clean, front desk staff were very competent and friendly (concierge not so much - we spoke to 4 different ones - managed to make restaurant reservation for a night we weren't even there, got tickets mixed up, not so hot on directions either ...). But, rooms were very comfortable and quite spacious. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Got my parking workout!”
Reviews.Author: sox15
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Hotwire - got their "hot rate". My review is based on the price I paid for the room. If I paid Hyatt's going rate, my review would be somewhat lower. My favorable experience started with the parking valet. He was so nice to let us park our car in front FOR FREE while we checked in and dropped off our bags in our room. We requested 2 beds, but the check in desk offered a rollaway at no additional charge. Our additional bed arrived within minutes, got set up, and he was out of there. We needed ice for our room and I used one of the small waste baskets from the room. We had a few water bottles from Trader Joe's we needed to chill. I get stopped in the hallway by a housekeeper, noticed my wastebasket and offered to get the ice for me because it was completely on the other side of our floor, but I declined it. I order room service and the person on the other end was so courteous to me, he kept addressing me as Mr Smith (not my real last name). When room service arrived with the food, it continued. I ordered the big wedge salad and sweet potato fries. The salad was surprisingly good. I highly recommend it. Every Hyatt employee I encountered was very nice! The room was your basic king standard room and a chaise lounge. Our room was on the second floor which had a view of the roof, other rooms, and the sky. No view, but it was quiet. I thought to myself, who the heck is blowing up fireworks? I found out it was coming from the upstairs room whenever they flushed the toilet! Haha... It took a bit of figuring out, but I finally figured out how to drop the shades to darken the room, open the drapes, and open the window. Haha Ok, the reasoning for dropping it 1 star...the $45 valet parking for registered hotel guests. I actually considered paying the price, but I had a problem with the only option of valet parking. I didn't want anyone parking my car. It's my car. We were in SF coming from Sacramento. So, I used these great Android apps (search for San Francisco parking) to find the best deal on a parking garage in the area and the other app was to determine which blocks had free parking at different times of the day. I paid $15 for an underground parking garage 2 blocks away from about 1pm through 9pm. I found a street parking space in front of the Hyatt from about 10pm until 7am the next day for free. I got lucky finding a street space in a residential neighborhood 2 blocks away from about 7am until 10am - our check out - (no time limits, since it was the 4th of July). Wow...saved $35. The way I see it...I got my cardio workout moving my car around. Oh, and the other con about this place is that it costs $12.95 for unlimited internet. It's $9.95 for 250MB of data. Boo If you want to save some money, there's a Trader Joe's and Safeway nearby. We got our bottled water from TJ's for about .50 cents each. Compare that to the $5 bottled water in our room!

Reviews.Title: “Just Super”
Reviews.Author: bonniebee1
Reviews.Content: As they say in real estate it is all about location, location, and location. And the Hyatt at Fisherman's wharf has the best - close to the wharf and all the many tourist attractions. This hotel is just great. Stayed at the hotel for five nights (June 24 - 28, 2011). The staff (front desk, housekeeping, valet) could not have been nicer. They were all all very pleasant and helpful. Managment has done an outstanding job training the staff. Check in was quick and very painless. The overall hotel is very clean and modern. In addition, the room was roomy, clean, and up-to-date (the deesk had various electrical plugs for charging; also an ipod docking station, and very good wi-fi). Probably the best bedding and linen around (I have stayed at lots off hotels around the world and do not make this statement highly). The outstanding bedding and linen provided five nights of sound sleeping. The bathorrm was spacious and well equiped (hair dryer, shampoo, lotion, soap, toothpaste). Also to note, the hotel's bar area is very nice (Tom the bartenderr was very nice and pleasant and could he mix a great Canadian Club Old Fashion). The hotel resturant was great for breakfast (the only meal eaten there). There is also the availibility of printing out airplane boarding passes free of charge and an ATM in the lobby. The pool and immediate area is very nice to (the pool was very warm, which is needed due to unpredicable SF weather). The only suggestion I could possible make is that the hotel needs a movie channel availalbe (AMC or TCM, for example), and a full shower door (to prevent the bathroom floors from getting slippery from the excessive water). In short, this is the place to stay when visitng the Wharf area.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday location for San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: cyberlion
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors the Fisherman's Wharf location is the best for holiday makers when visiting San Francisco. Near the water, restaurants, tourist activities, cable car stop, ferries, street cars to CBD, piers etc. The hotel is only 5 floors high to blend with its surrounds yet we still had a good view from the 5th floor. Room was a good size, comfortable, clean and quiet. We used the restaurant and bar on a couple of occasions. Breakfast was very good. For dinner would recommend the really good BBQ dishes to share. Convenient laundry facility was a winner for us as we were able to head off for the rest of our holidays with clean cloths after 6 days here. Used the Grand Limousine services several times (through hotel) and found them to be really good as well. Happy to stay here again. Note when booking via internet as we did that the downtown Hyatt is more suitable for business people.

Reviews.Title: “Pure room at the Hyatt was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kudzie100
Reviews.Content: Not having been to San Francisco I was not sure where to stay. Picked the Hyatt at Fisherman's wharf because it had a Pure Room which was supposed to be great for allergy suffers. I am allergic to perfume which makes my life a misery in most hotels. It was a true vacation for me at the Hyatt to be able to brreath in the room. My granddaughter loved being able to walk to everything at the wharf and even China Town though that was a bit of a hike. Would stay there again in a heart beat! P.S. parking is out rageous but if you are renting a car, use the car rentals overnight parking for 10 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: b_waldrep
Reviews.Content: I try very hard to always stay at Hilton product hotels because you can normally count on excellent service. This hotel was no exception. They went out of their way to make our stay pleasant and accommodating. The hotel was within easy walking distance to everything we wanted to do and wonderful restaturants. Our room faced the courtyard and it was extremely peaceful. We look forward to returning again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FabuToronto
Reviews.Content: Great small Hotel in a wonderful location at Fisherman's Wharf!!!! Valet parking at $44.00 was convenient but a little expensive; High Speed internet should be provided free! The safe in the room was located on a very shelf in the closet and was very difficult for my wife who is just over 5 feet tall to reach without a great effort!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: anniversarycouple93
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very comfortable and spacious. We had a king suite overlooking the pool and right near the fitness center. The room included a small fridge which was handy for keeping the wine and cheese we accumulated at the ferry building. The location was great and the hotel even offered a free town car shuttle to the financial district which we took advantage of every morning. Service was prompt and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get a room in the front”
Reviews.Author: soccerrref
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and we stayed three nights but very noisy from our room. The first night around 10:45 PM, lot's of noise and talking out front. Thought it was just guest checking in etc. Second night, same thing, starting around 10:45 and lasting to 11:15. Said something to the clerk in the morning and they offered to move us, but with 4 bags and lots of other stuff decided to stick it out. Third night it was so noisy I called the front desk and they said they would take care of it. I think that the hotel employees take their smoke breaks in the front of the hotel at that time of night. It's crazy to have to put up with that for what we were paying. Did'nt get a lot of comfort from the front desk when we checked out and talked about the noise. Would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugVancouver29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short walk from Fisherman's Warf, clean rooms with comfortable bedding. Great service from both hotel and restaurant staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: bambue
Reviews.Content: they messed up our reservation. instead of 2 times 2 nights, they had booked 4 times 2 nights - however they did it us we used their own booking system. rooms were clean, nice and more than just mid-sized. we didn't like it too make facing to the street as you can here the traffic the whole night but the bus stop service in front of our room stopped at least after midnight. the location is very good. close to fisherman's Warf, the sea, Alcatraz, souvenir shops and just the pear itself. just close by you may also find the cable car entrance and of course bus or other tram stops. parking is expensive but in our charge valet parking was included as well as breakfast. breakfast buffet is mid-sized. not larger than that you can get at Best Westerns. Just a small turn down. I would recommend Sheraton, Hyatt at the Fishermanâ€™s Warf. You may also go to the Radisson but this offers services on a lower level and you have to check very carefully what room you get there (advantage: youâ€™re directly at the cost)

Reviews.Title: “This was an OK stay”
Reviews.Author: josanpu
Reviews.Content: Hyatt is generally a good choice, and this was a good place. Not great, but if you want to be in this area, fine. No real problems, just not fabulous. Very slow elevators. The pool was very chlorinated and uniformly 3 1/2 feet deep - so: good for kids, awful for adults. There is a limited time of day when to sun reaches it, so you have to work out your swim time accordingly. The restuarant was really a sports bar, which I found truly off-putting. Nevertheless, the waiters were very friendly & helpful, and the happy hour calamari and wines were excellent. Comfy beds, good white ginger soaps, coffee maker in room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: JSMBali
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days in San Francisco after visiting the US on our way back to Hong Kong. We wanted to book a hotel that was convenient to restaurants and sight seeing. This hotel is in an excellent location and within a few minutes walk you have a wide selection of excellent seafood restaurants and sights to see. The service was absolutely fantastic in this hotel - staff were exceptionally friendly and super quick to respond to anything we needed. The rooms were clean, albeit a bit basic with respect to amenities and the mini-bar, but we had a great nights sleep in a very comfortable bed. For those of you that want a convenient, clean hotel with exceptional service that is minutes from some excellent restaurants and sights to see then I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malex528
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed 5 nights at the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf and found the staff wonderful and the hotel very clean. When we checked in Regina was very gracious and helpful. We stopped by the desk a couple of other time for directions, bus routes, etc and everyone gave us great directions. We were always greeted by someone and housekeeping was very nice and efficient. The location is great: near the wharf, restaurnants, and transportation. We used alot of public transportation and saved a bundle with MUNI passes and found it a great way to get around. The Hyatt is a great place to stay! I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at an just average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dazzchris
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at the Hyatt in April. Rooms are pretty average and can be very noisy if facing the street. My 13yr old son was very sick in the middle of the night with food poisoning, the hotel could not have been more helpful, in particular the manager the next morning. Fantastic location, easy walking distance to everything. Safeway just around the corner. We actually walked into downtown SFO one day and I think it was only a 30 minute walk, pretty easy. Hired bikes to ride over Golden Gate, great fun! Do not miss the Boudin Bakery, fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel... Let down at the end”
Reviews.Author: skyeyed
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the right location. We stayed for 5 nights and were very happy all round. The staff were great, price was good, rooms were clean and facilities were just right for our needs. I rate this hotel! The only disappointment was administrational...The hotel failed to credit our Gold membership for the stay. We booked through Hyatt, why does this happen?

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: dizydotz
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was very clean, updated & the bed was comfy. The location was excellent and accessible to everything. A great little restaurant across the street for a delicious breakfast and one in the lobby of the hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Universal22
Reviews.Content: We spent eight days (9 nights) at the Hyatt At Fisherman's Wharf and were more than happy with the Hotel, Location, Cleanliness, Staff & Room Size. The staff always greeted you with a smile every time you left or came into the hotel, they were helpful with any queries. The rooms were always clean with ample toiletries & Coffee/Tea provided daily (if I had one complaint it would be that if you do not request to have your bedding changed daily - to help with the environment (as most hotels do these days) then the bed is not made up as it would be if the bedding was changed, if you do not leave the bedding turned back the bed may not be made or made as neatly as it is on arrival). We had a room on the third floor over looking the Jacuzzi, other members of our party had a room at the far end of the Pool, this was never an issue with privacy or noise, the pool area is open from 7am - 9pm, each room has net curtains and a blind and from the outside you could not see into the rooms (maybe you might see in if all room lights were on and it was late evening but you would pull down the blind if you were in the room). The poll was used a little but the Jacuzzi was often in use and by many guests, a great place to have a chat with people from various countries, we did not think we would use it much but all of our party did, a great relaxer after a day of walking the city. The hotel is situated in an excellent location, very close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, not too far from Pier 33 and even Pier 3 is only a 10-15 minute walk away. Located very close to two Cable Car Turn-a-rounds, a very short walk to the F route Street Car start and a few minutes walk to the various buses. A Walgreens is a few blocks away where Muni Pass tickets can be purchased for $13 for three days or $26 for 7 days (daily tickets also available, buses & street cars $2 a ride, cable car $5 a ride). Pick up a Muni Pass map for $3.95 and you can get one form of transport combination to any where you want to go with very little walking, which we did after walking some of the main areas on the first day. San Francisco transport is excellent it all runs often and efficiently and a great way to take in the sites and fully experience riding the city buy it hanging off the Cable car or sitting in comfort and taking in the views. Taxis to and from SFO Airport cost approximately $42 plus a tip and takes 20 - 30 minutes (traffic dependant), you can always take the Bart from the airport and then a street car or bus to your hotel, but for a party of four we decided the taxi cost was very good and saved the hassle of dragging bags around. For convenient shopping Cost Plus World Market. Trader Joe's & Safeway just one block away for food, drinks and snacks. I would highly recommend this hotel to visitors to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kat1942
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great from the moment we drove in. The location was within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and many of the attractions. We walked to Crooked St and many other places. The could not have been more helpful. They made sure we saw everything that was worth seeing. The suggested Restaurants that were great. The room itself was great, we just wish we could have stayed longer and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, great check-in experience”
Reviews.Author: pasowine
Reviews.Content: We came here for our anniversary and were a little apprehensive. It far our visit exceeded expectations. You can't find a better place near the Wharf, Coit Tower, Tours to Alcatraz, bus and cable cars to downtown. Maybe that's because we started with a good experience at checkin. First, our room wasn't ready yet as it should have been. So we were given courtesy drinks while we waited at the Sports Bar at the hotel. That was nice and the wait wasn't long. The woman at the front desk was so pleasant and polite. She answered numerous questions we had. The room was oustanding! It had a very high ceiling, great work desk area, and an extremely comfortable bed. It was quiet although you could hear occasional street noise (to be expected at the Wharf). We even tired out the pool and spa, although it did feel you were in a fishbowl. Checkout was a little long. The hotel is close to the wharf, Shops, a World Market, Cable Cars, Columbus street for a bus to Union Square and AT&T Park - along with all the fun cafes and restaurants towards Coit Tower and North Beach. We'd definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great pool and the breakfast buffet was delicious:)”
Reviews.Author: la-bobo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 2 blocks from the Wharf. Request the "Balance Package" when making reservations with Hyatt. The package includes free Valet parking-$45.00 value and 2 free buffet breakfasts-$19.00 value each at Knuckles Restaurant located in the hotel. It was delicious! The pool was great and the hotel put our family on the 3rd floor, same floor as the pool. Castagnola's Restaurant (on the wharf) Do not waste your time and money!! The food was terrible, overpriced and the service was horrible and they didnt care..

Reviews.Title: “No customer service in ordinary rooms”
Reviews.Author: AndrewStein
Reviews.Content: It still surprises me that in this day and age there are hotels that feel they can get away with charging for internet access. I can live with this but this hotel has the worst customer service I have ever come across. Not only do you have to pay for wireless internet access it's for one device only - so if you have a notebook computer and/or an iPhone/Ipad you have to pay for the each one if you want to use them. There is no printing at all and when I asked the concierge if I could get a theater ticket printed he at first said yes but then said that is computer was not accessible so he couldn't get my usb key into it and that was then end of it. If you are a business traveler this would have to be one of the worst places to stay. It's a great location but the rooms are pretty ordinary more like three or four than five star and all the facilities are very basic. If you do stay here I suggest using the free program "Connectify" which allows you to share internet access with your devises.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hyatt I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: megjo
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the theme of this hotel is to echo that of Alcatraz - only Alcatraz has more spirit. We were in one of their larger guest rooms which meant the window was at one end overlooking a very drab court yard - or as we referred to it "exercise yard". As the window was at the end of the room, there was little natural light and with the walls painted pale blue, there were only a few lamps and they didn't emit much light, it was nothing short of depressing. Yes, it would seem they have tried to 'modernize' the rooms, but you know, you can paint an elephant, but it is still an elephant. There were 4 of us in the room, yet each day we had to ask for additional towels as they would only leave 3. We didn't leave a tip at the end of our stay (normally we do for housekeeping) as it seemed to be optional whether the trash was taken away and in what quantity & given we were there for 7 nights, there should have been more attention paid to cleaning. The beds were small & uncomfortable and the bathroom door opens into the middle of the room - 2 issues with this: 1. if you had the bathroom door open and one of your party opens the external door then you would want to hope you were covered up as anyone walking past can see right into the bathroom. 2. it's pretty easy to knock one of your party out if they are standing in the wrong spot and you open that door too quickly - dangerous with children! Agree with other - where is the concierge? Never to be found or always on the phone! Location is good for first timers to San Fran, but now we know our way around, we will stay in Union Square next time. Make sure you pre-request a fridge a they aren't standard room equipment. Oh & they changed the internet provider while we were there but there was no explanation of cost etc - sloppy communication. We loved San Fran but this hotel did dampen our trip a little even though we tried no to let it. We did speak to the manager about our concerns but little was done in the way of help to address it and we are Hyatt Gold Pass members. Particularly disappointing as they had our money for 6 months as we pre-paid our accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value if you get a package deal”
Reviews.Author: craulocsol
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick but finding the room was a challenge. It was so far from the elevator that it was tedious going back if you forget something in your room. Over-all I liked this hotel. Room size was adequate, modern furnishings, very clean & beds provided good night's rest. My teenage daughters enjoyed it too. Had dinner at Knuckles, the hotel resto and highly recommend their mojito steak. Dessert was super delicious as well. Buffet breakfast which was included was average, not much to choose from. So if it is not included w/ the room, it would be best to eat elsewhere since there are other places nearby. Can't say anything more about the location, the name says it all: Fisherman's Wharf! There is a business center where you can check-in for your flights and print boarding passes for free. Very convenient. I rated excellent value because I got a deal on line which included valet parking & breakfast for two. Had to pay $9.99/day for internet but that is cheap considering some European hotels will charge you 5 euros per hr for internet access. Check-out was a breeze. I was curious about how much the regular price would have been and was almost floored when I found out I only paid about a third of the cost. Bottom line: take advantage of those on-line deals.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Amenities Doesn't Equal Comfort”
Reviews.Author: bikerbop
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location if you want to be near the Wharf. It's conveniently located to the historic F street car which takes you all the way to The Castro. As for the room... we had a king bed which appeared to be created from two completely differently beds as there was giant rift in the middle. Whomever slept on the right side, and it was usually me, had to constantly shift for fear of falling off. The bathroom's appearance is quite modern. However, the hotel sacrificed functionality with comfort and possibly common sense. The shower head is in the ceiling. As the shower's "door" doesn't move, you have to reach across the shower to turn on the water. Be prepared for blasts of cold water to hit you as you're turning it in. The ceiling is high so anyone under 6 feet can't adjust the head. The design looks nice but as for guest comfort it just doesn't work. Sit once in the lobby and you'll see why the chairs look the way they do. Clearly the hotel does not want guests sitting in the lobby. The chairs have a modern aesthetic appeal for those that like that sort of decorating style but are completely nonfunctional. The concierge must be a mythical creature. No matter how hard we tried, we never managed to see anyone at the desk. While we were there they hosted some sort of event for little girls so we were overrun with them in the pool and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: zoebella
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend stay at this Hyatt. We were surprised how clean and modern the room was in the touristy fishermans wharf area. The bed was very comfortable. The location was great. We liked that it was not right on the wharf (3 min walk) but central to everything you want to see in san fran. It was close walk to the north beach neughborhood (little italy) which has lots of restaurants followed by union square with lots of shopping. My husband went running the other direction along the bay towards the golden gate bridge and towards the marina district. I walkedthis route and there were beautiful awe inspiring views. We found a cute coffee shop 2 min from the hotel with awesome chai and bagels etc. called coffee adventures. We also enjoyed boudins on the wharf for a casual lunch, they make their own sourdough bread.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: byrdie50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in late April 11. The staff were very welcoming and friendly, particularly Tami who checked us both in and out on the front desk. We arrived at 9am and were very grateful to be able to access our room straight away. We requested a king bed but it hadn't been guaranteed and they weren't able to provide this, but the room was big and spacious, including the bathroom. They have coin operated laundry machines on each floor ($1.50 washer, $2 drier), they sell tide powder in the vending machine - it was great to be able to use this service. I swam in the pool once and the pool area was a lovely sun trap. They provide beach towels and the jacuzzi was very nice. We ate in the restaurant at 8pm on the Tuesday night - the food and drinks were fine but the service wasn't great - it was pretty busy but we ordered 2 cocktails which arrived 10 mins apart and my salad didn't have the chicken on it which I ordered - so I had to wait another 10 mins whilst my husband ate his meal - it didn't make for a relaxing dinner really. The waiter seemed more concerned with presenting an image of being very professional but actually could have paid more attention to getting our order correct. We took a town car booked through concierge to sfo airport for a flat rate of $55 including tip - it is $45 for a taxi so this was well worth it. The area around the hotel is great, 10 mins to north beach, couple of blocks to the wharf, 15 mins (uphill!) to coit tower. We also stayed in union square for 2 days and much preferred the hyatt's location, it was all very relaxed and really helped you feel like you were on holiday. I'd highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: bemusedobserver
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 5 nights at Hyatt at Fisherman's Wharf. Had a nice room with 2 queen beds, and very spacious bathroom. The only disappointment was that this was the 5th hotel we stayed at on our US trip, and it was the only one without a fridge, although there was an ice machine just down the hall. The pool and hot tub were in a sheltered courtyard area, and they needed to be as it could be quite windy. Fitness room was well equipped. When I asked about internet access, I was told it was $9.95 per day, unless I was a Hyatt Gold Passport holder. It was free to apply, so I signed up and got free internet access for the whole stay. Parking was very expensive, we arrived at about 8pm and were taking the rental car back the next morning, but it would have cost $52 to park there overnight, so I parked a block away for $25. Didn't really need a car for the rest of the stay, we used one of the many hop on, hop off open top buses that stop at all the major points of interest. A 2 day pass was about $30 each, and because we bought our passes after 2.30, we got the rest of that day, and the next 2 days included. Also got the cable car one day, but very crowded, and it wasn't running for the whole route due to road repairs. Lots of restaurants within easy walking distance, ranging from fast food to fine dining. There's a nice breakfast place right across the road, but it gets very busy, and you may have to wait for a table, ot there's a Denny's in the Holiday Inn just around the corner. On returning to the airport at the end of our stay, we had 3 options, a shuttle bus that stops at other hotels for about $17 per person, a hotel' limo' for $55, or a taxi. We took the taxi, which cost $40 for 3 of us.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY nice stay, had a fab time at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Bandsareme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night last week ( 25th April 2011 ), and what can i say, this is one of the nicer hotels i've visited before!! The check-in staff were all so nice, the hotel its self is beautiful, the room was amazing, the bathroom really trendy. We had a hot tub outside which was great! The room was spotless, and the bed was one of the most comfortable i've ever slept in!! As we are english we wanted a nice cup of tea in the morning, and i went downstairs, and the lady gave me a tea with Soya milk, and some biscuits all on the house which made my day!! Only comment is, parking in San Francisco is SO expensive generally speaking. The valet parking was $55 which is quite abit, so we parked in the car park down the road and across ( 1 min walk ), and it was $30 for the night!! Overall, i am SO happy i chose this hotel!! Enjoy your stay if you do visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Somuchtosee01
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel. Position is good for the Wharf - 3 mins walk, 6 mins to Pier 39 and less than 15 mins to Pier 33 (Alcatraz ferry). Large room, comfortable bed. Big bonus is the Breakfast buffet - really good value! The only negative is the Valet paking - expensive (unless you book a package). Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to see SF, but really only 3 star hotel. Don't expect too much for your dollars.”
Reviews.Author: Seyahbiz
Reviews.Content: Although a Hyatt Hotel, this certainly doesn't live up to the quality normally associated with this chain. Staff are friendly and helpful, it's just the hotel is old and our room seemed dated. Pillows were all extremely soft feather style, causing both my wife and I to have stiff necks and headaches after the first night. Beds advertised as special were only double size. My booking form also said "marble bath" but that means the bench top, not the bath apparently after I enquired if we had the right room. After having stayed at wonderful (and same priced) hotels in Vegas, Reno, Monument Valley, and Tahoe, we were "underwhelmed" by what we expected to be a better hotel. Maybe we should have chosen the Best Western or Holiday Express hotels right across the street. The Wifi is generally free at those places and they try harder to make you comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel overall, didn't like the shower head”
Reviews.Author: Ilan_H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my wife and baby. Pros: Good facilities. Professional reception. Crib was ready in room when we arrived. Parking available close by and costs 32$ tax included. Modern room. View to pool, quiet. Denny's close by for breakfast. Great location near fisherman's wharf. Cons: Small room, but not very small (stayed in a king bed room). Shower head, although modern, isn't convenient. Noise from A/C. Breakfast not included in room price. Internet not included in room price. Only single elevator that gets to the exit without stairs (there are additional elevators that reach to half a floor below the exit). On site valet costs over 50$.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the wharf and very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on April 10, 2011. We got an excellent deal on the room and wanted something close to the wharf. You can tell that this is an older hotel but the rooms have been tastefully updated. The beds were very comfortable and aside from just being a basic room......it had everything we needed. We only stayed in San Fran for one night. The hotel was only about a block from Fisherman's Wharf, so it is very convienent. We did enjoy the buffet breakfast, but the selection was very small. What buffet does not have a pancake or waffle??? Really. If we had paid the $20 a piece for this buffet, we would have been really upset. We were also fortunate enough to get free parking at the hotel. The one thing I did notice about being there, is that when it gets dark......the city streets are deserted. My husband and I did enjoy a few cocktails in the bar. I recommend the margaritas. I highly recommend doing a boat tour of the bay, and a bus city tour. They were great!!!! All the employees at the hotel were very helpful and friendly, and made us feel very comfortable there. If you are going to the wharf......I highly recommend this place for the friendliness of it's staff, the clean comfortable rooms and the vacinity to the wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: chloe6090
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here March 2011. We had a Respire Room which overlooked the pool The Room was very clean, the bed was fantastic we slept very comfortably. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. A lot of things are within walking distance. We ate at Knuckles which was very good and across the street was a little restaurant which also had wonderful breakfasts. I can't remember the name - sorry. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Hyatt Fisherman's Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: Shuweb
Reviews.Content: We booked the room for one night directly with the hotel; we made a reservation for a hypo-allergenic room, which is something that they offer. The reservation process, of course, was very smooth. At check in, we were pleasantly surprised to find out that we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite - and my what a wonderful room! There's a half bath as you enter the suite, and a very large living room, consisting of large leather "sofas" and glass table, and a separate area with "lounge chairs," a smaller table and a large flat screen TV. There was a place to chill the wine, etc. And further into the suite was a separate bedroom, with a very comfortable bed, another TV, and of course a nice "walk in closet" and a large bathroom. I place "quotes" on some of these words because I honestly don't know what they're called; I just know that they were very nice. The staff were very nice; they remembered our name, and were very responsive. We were in SF for a dinner with friends at Roy's (which by the way was terrific!), and we decided ahead of time to spend the night in SF rather than drive home that night. My only comment is that breakfast was only OK. The buffet selection was lacking, and the pancakes just weren't good. I'd consider going elsewhere for breakfast. As for location, it doesn't get much closer to Fisherman's Wharf. This was great because we left our car at the hotel and walked to Pier 39 early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: LoveourholsBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Hyatt on our first visit to San Francisco. The hotel is very well located a few blocks back from the wharf, with shops en route. It is in a fairly quiet street, so although we werent facing the street, I wouldnt imagine noise was a problem. Our room was very nice, a good size, and overlooked the pool. (not that we used it as the weather was a bit chilly for our liking - tho others did.) There was no kettle, but there was a coffee maker which produced a reasonable cup of coffee. We didnt eat in the restaurant/bar, but we did have drinks there and it was pleasant enough. The concierge was good at recommending restaurants and places to go, and reception staff were always very helpful..

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: phillirit
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel location close to wharf area close to cable cars for a ride downtown we stayed here 2 nights, upgrade was given had a perfect view of city skyline. room was clean, pleasant also pleasant staff, check hotel site for package including breakfast, parking it works out better, would stay again definitely. Take notice of valet parkers if they tell you to take umbrella they are wright.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: joanjustjj
Reviews.Content: Get the packaged deal, which includes breakfast, it was delicious! The room was very, very clean and this hotel was in the perfect location- down by the warf and pier 39.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Touring San Fran”
Reviews.Author: dillydallying
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was in a perfect location as a base for exploring San Francisco. Two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and right at the Cable Car turn around for the Powell/Mason line. I suggest going to the Wharf and for a cable car ride; both are touristy, but still quite fun. The hotel staff were incredibly nice and upon check-in offered us a valet parking rate for the self-park rate (still $36/day, but that's what it'll cost in San Fran for parking anywhere). The hotel room was nice, with comfortable beds and very clean, but it's beginning to show a little wear and tear. We booked this hotel because it has a pool, not many do in San Francisco, and the courtyard with the pool was nice and we swam, even in February. This area is starting to show its age as well. We ate at the attached Knuckles restaurant and the food was quite good, with some nice wines. Go for the AAA-rate with breakfast included and this hotel is a fair deal.

Reviews.Title: “Why not try the Hyatt, a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RESPOO
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from a long weekend at the Hyatt, I spend alot of time researching hotels before travelling. You will not be dissapointed even with the perk of a great price on Travel zoo, including breakfast. We found all the staff very accomendating, not one issue. If you are travelling with a family of four, reserve the oversized room, lots of space. Fisherman's Wharf is really a one day event, but traveling to Union Square is easy, either by taxi or cable car. The cable car is expensive, but really you have to say you did the ride. Next time we will stay in the Union Square area. There is a safeway store two blocks away if you would like to pick up grocery items, a fridge request at the hotel is a great help.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location for a tourist visit to San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: explore3115
Reviews.Content: 1st thing is 1st. I would not have stayed here if not for the great rate at travel zoo. My room rate included parking ($44) and breakfast ($18) was great. Highlights: ~Comp umbrella ella ella when we forgot ours ($25 charged back to the room if you don't return it.) ~ comfy bed.. so nice ~Breakfast buffet was varied each day ~Service in the hotel rest. was good. Ipad menus were cool. ~Hot coco in the lobby on the cold afternoons ~Central to all the touristy fun stuff ~ Room was clean ~ felt safe ~ spa was a decent size for 5 adults and 2 small children ~ rate through travel zoo Badlights: ~Concierege was not very nice, helpful or even looked like she enjoyed her job. I felt like I put her out when asking questions. March 5/6 Saturday night and Sunday night staff ~Pool closed at 9:00pm, a little early I think ~We were checked in 3 hours late and spent our time in the bar (pitcher of beer $19) ~When we got to our room the bellman forgot two of our bags, we had a bit of a panic when they could only find one and then they ended up locating it. ~ ohh that pesky fire alarm at 4:50am, set off by a staff member by accident. We all make mistakes but at 4:50am??? ~ no comp mimosas after fire alarm ~ finally figured out the tricky elevators on our way to check out, look for the button on the inside door of the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Easy walking distance to wharf!”
Reviews.Author: Aeroplay
Reviews.Content: Outstanding value. Look at the travel search engines for a price base line then call them direct for the best deal. Our room was great and the breakfast buffet was outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bassngal1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding. If I had say something bad about it, The halls to the rooms are darks and the carpet is old. I can live with that. All of the staff was friendly and helpful and even made me laugh a couple of times. The rooms were clean clean. The price was outstanding for San Francisco. The pool was fabulous. The hotel is located near everything. Room service was wonderful and the food in the restraunt was wonderful. One hint don't bother paying for the City view, you get to see a Borders book store. I would stay at this hotel again and again. The staff was wonderful to my children acknowledging them everytime they walked or ran by.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay - would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: journeyman29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of february and everything was faultless. For a very good value price we had an enormous room (with 2 double beds), a fantastic choice for breakfast and a superb location. The hotel also had a reasonable size pool and outdoor hot tub which we didn't use and a decent size fitness room. Moreover, the staff were all extremely helpful and friendly throughout the stay. We ate in the hotel bar on two of our nights in San Fran and whereas the menu selection was somewhat standard bar-fare, the quality of the food and the service were excellent

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed :(”
Reviews.Author: ChevalGris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not what I expected out of a Hyatt. The location is of course GREAT, and it has a nice modern, clean look. We got a GREAT priceline price, so I can't complain too much, but if I had paid full price, I would have been very disappointed. The worst part was the horrible shower. Clearly invented by someone who had never used it, and probably a guy (although my bf didn't like it either.) The head only has like 12 little jets -- not enough to keep you warm, and it's mounted on the ceiling, so unless you want it pouring on your head the whole time, you have to be out of the water and getting cold. The exhaust fan is right there in the shower with you sucking the warm air out. Very unpleasant way to start your day! Also, the TV is very poor quality...definitely not HD, but very noticably grainy! The bed had lots of nice pillows, but in itself was rather hard and we didn't sleep well.

Reviews.Title: “TOO MANY EXTRA CHARGES”
Reviews.Author: 4CBL
Reviews.Content: $50 to park ! No free internet access and no using 2 computers on the same internet charge. Bad shower.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel but they downgrade you instead up upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: Pixie_0
Reviews.Content: We spent ages looking for the ideal hotel in San Fran, it was between the Fairmont Ghiardelli and the Hyatt Fishermans. We eventually chose the Hyatt because it was somewhat cheaper and ticked many of the boxes in terms of Modern Decor, and we specifically called and requested the corner deluxe room due to its size, and it was about GBP 300 cheaper for the 3 nights than the other hotel. Upon arrival and check-in we were advised our corner room was not available but they have downgraded us to a smaller room taken $50 off for each night. I told them it is unacceptable because we had spent weeks if not months choosing and preparing for our room choice. I also mentioned that one normally gets UPGRADED when the hotel cannot fulfill our booking. (There were conferences being held there which may have not helped our situation) We grudgingly went up to see the downgraded room.
